text: Beautiful head, dark black color. Aroma is not that promising. Light roast and coffee but not fruity at all ... But it tastes beautiful ... There is some roast and coffee but the bitterness is so IIPA alike... Wonderful.

Po otwarciu butelki bucha chmiel; żywica, iglaki i co nieco ze strony słodowej: czekolada deserowa i trochę kawy. Jest intensywnie, ale nienachalnie. Po przelaniu do szkła chmiel na pierwszym planie, intensywne aromaty leśne, lekko wpadające w ziemistość, tuż za chmielem wyraźniejsza kawa i kakao. W smaku balans przesunięty na stronę chmielową, stylowo, ale słody nadają tu pełni i gładkości. Żywica, trochę paloności w stronę prażonego słonecznika, kawa (czuć, że jest w składzie, a nie pochodzi tylko od słodów), posmak kakao dobrze gra tu z chmielem, po ogrzaniu dochodzi nieco więcej czekolady. Goryczka w punkt, średnio-wysoka, ale mega szlachetna, przyjemna, bez uczucia ściągnia, niemal 10% alko również ukryte perfekcyjnie. Zdecydowanie najlepsze Black IPA, jakie piłem.

chyba troche przereklamowane, a moze i nie?... fakt milo sie pije, ladna pianka ladnie oblepia szklo, alkohol ukryty bardzo dobrze, chwile u mnie lezalo wiec pewnie dlatego moge wypowiedziec sie jedynie o cechach stoutu, ktore sa bardzo przyjemne

Bottle at Brus Copenhagen. This is the beer that made me fall in love with To Øl and I still think its one of the best beers Ive ever tried. The aroma is mostly coffee and chocolate, quite pleasant although not too strong. Everything about it appart from that is almost perfect though. The aftertaste is probably the longest and most intense of any beer Ive ever had. Incredible.

Bottle from Appellation Wines Dalry. Pours opaque dark brown, nice fawn head. Nose of fresh coffee grind, dark chocolate, toffee cake, dank tropical fruit. Taste is dry espresso, green hop notes, dark chocolate.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. 
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - nettles or coriander and of course, coffee bean, up front. Toffee and a touch of something citrus.
Taste - big sugary coffee note. Light a flat white with an extra shot. Molasses too. Burnt coffee finish.
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy middle section. Dry, crunchy finish. 
Overall - complex and more than just a single dimensional coffee beer.

Słone i gorzkie nade wszystko, dla niewyrobionego podniebienia może być nazbyt agresywne, doceniam ładnie ukryty alkohol, ale piwo zdaje się przeceniane jako black ipa, którego charakterystyczne cechy gubi w drodze do wyrazistości

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruit, chocolate, roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown/black beer with a medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Amazing Black IPA which feels slightly like an hoppy Imperial Stout if you ask me. Perfect appearance and palate as well, but the aroma could have been stronger.

Very dark brown hazy with rich creamy give / light brown head. Slight sweet malt and hops aroma. Strong bitter taste with medium sourness and some vanilla sweetness rich of roasted malt, coffee and spicy notes. Bit dusty. Lasting strong hoppy bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 Stupidly good beer. Its drinkable like an IPA and with mid-lo body but then the aftertaste somehow hits that full coffee richness. Only exemplar Ive had of the style not being an oxymoron.

Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu. Zdecydowanie jedno z najlepzych IBA, jakie miałem okazję pić. W nosie kawa, czekolada, żywica, akcenty owoców tropikalnych i słodka wanilia. Kremowa konsystencja, pełne, aksamitne. W ustach dużo iglaków, kawy, czekolady, ziemi i akcent wanilii. Sól morska, hm nie pamiętam.

2016 catch up - Bottle at home - Stunning flavour. Didnt detect the coffee, but there was a soft warmth, hops, malt and cream. Alcohol was very well hidden. The only problem is that it killed me the next day and this was the only beer I had the night before. Really, really nice, but seriously let down by the after effects whihc results int he mark down.
12 ounce green glass bottle. Dark pour. Creamy head. Malty nose with chocolate and a bit of roast. Bitter.

Czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana kremowa, drobna, obfita, tworzy ładny lacing. W zapachu mleczna czekolada, kakao, kawa, chmiele. W smaku z początku słodko, czekoladowo, po tym wchodzą nuty żywiczne, kawa, paloność. Wysycenie nisko-średnie, goryczka średnia, posmak żywiczny i kawowy.
Dark and bitter with a smooth, rounded finish. Slightly smoky without being offputting-ly so. Overall a great, highly recommended black IPA.
Strong notes of coffee, some cocoa and some hoppy, black with a good brown head, medium/full body, carbonation is soft, taste is similar and very intense, bitter with hoppy final...wonderful.

Bottle 0,33L. Black as night with large, light brown head. Aroma of alcohol comes first when I was pouring it into the glass, but it goes to the background later and aroma of coffee, chocolate, caramel and sherry comes in front. Full bodied beer starts light sweet with chocolate, slowly turning to a medium bitter finish with some salty moments in between. A bit heavy, but overall great beer!

[8661-20160827] Tap. Sweet toffee and green leafy hoppy coffee aroma. Black cola body with a medium-lasting foamy tan head. Grainy toasted sweet nutty wood flavour has a long sweet finish. Full body. Tasty. (9/4/8/4/16) 4.1

330 ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a light brown head. The aroma is medium hoppy and light to medium malty with a flowery, herbal hop character and a solid background of roasted malt with a lot of coffee and some caramel and toffee. Medium to full body with a low carbonation a light sweetness and a light to medium, lasting bitterness, very balanced. Very rich flavor of both hops and malt - dark berries, caramel, some honey, overripe cherry, sweet herbal infusion and some coffee, that is not as present as in the aroma and very light alcoholic notes.

330 ml, dark brown, hazy, floating particles, beige head.
floral, dried fruits, malty, syrup, coffee, dark berries
surprisingly (after smell) unsweet taste, well balanced in aroma and taste.
full body. nice bitterness with finish.
very tasty beer
Nice taste of coffee, chocolate and a bit of salt in the end. Its a nice big beer.

Black colored beer with a small permanent beige head.
What yeast flakes at the bottom of the glass.
Tastes like dark malts, lots of coffee, quite bitter, fruity and roasted.
Boozy, coconut, coffee, dark caramel, medium bitterrness, noble hops profile.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2017 Backlog: Świetny zapach. Ma w sobie początek karmelowy, który przeradza się w kawę, a kawa pali się w ustach po czym nadchodzi wzmocnienie wykręcanych kubków smakowych przez chmiel. Wyśmienicie skomponowany mieszanka wyrazistości chmielu i słodu. Balans jest znakomity, a następstwo smaków aż nieprawdopodobnie zaplanowane. Wspomniana goryczka lekko orzeźwia, nadając kontrast ciemnym słodom, jest "zielona" na języku, ale nie da się nie wyczuć słodkawych owoców z pomarańczową skórką. Smak po łyku rozciąga się w czasie i powraca do kawy i mocno palonych smaczków.
Its just amazing! Hands down my favourite beer on the planet and im well over the 1000 mark at this stage. You just have to try it for yourself. Its perfection!

Mega pijalne jak na wersje imperialną. Co tu się dzieje to głowa mała.Na początku zarówno w aromacie jak i smaku wychodzi dośc wyraźna kawa, która zaraz potem ucieka zmieniając się w posmak typowej black ipy (niestety brak żywicy czy iglaków) a w następnym łyku znów czuć uderzenie kawy. Idealny dowód na to, że da się ten styl łączyć z kawą tylko trzeba to zrobić umiejętnie tak by wspomniany smak nie przykrył chmielu.
Więcej nie napisze bo to ocena po czasie a nie zrobiłem szczegółowych notatek. Może jak będe pił jeszcze raz to nie popełnie tego błędu.
33cl bottle. Dark color. Thin brown head. Medium bitterness. Balanced taste. Medium body. Dry finish. Balanced palate. Aroma and flavour is roasted, mango, chocolate, salto, cacao, hops, herby.

Aroma: coffee, black malts. No hoppy aroma. Black color with nice creamy head. Well hidden alcohol, but hops are not so expressive for 120 IBU. Bitterness is accurate, but unfortunately no hopppy flavours nor aromas. Disappointment for BIPA nr 2 in the world. 
Solipiwko - Black Bitch is so much better!!!!!!!

Bottle. Black beer with large beige head with good duration and lacing. Aroma of coffee, pine, resin and toffee. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter: lots of coffee, bitter chocolate, again some toffee, finishes roasted and hoppy: coffee and pine, quite long bitter finish. Medium to full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, well hidden alcohol. A bit stale. Good, enjoyable BIPA, not perfect, but the bottle may have been not fresh enough.
Taste is slightly sweet and dry, dark malts, hops, rubber, oak, cardboard, and many many many coffee. Long bitterness & dry mouthfeel.

Very nice aroma, first there is mostly pine, roasted sunflower seeds and a bit of fruits, then it transits to coffee aroma.
Looks perfect, with great, persistent head.
Rather low sweetness, medium bitterness. Pretty well balanced. A bit too much alcohol in flavor, still, a very good beer
Bottle. Dark brown color with tan head. Aroma is chocolate, hoppy, piney, coffee. Taste is chocolate, coffee, quite some piney hops. Medium carbonation. More on the stouty side of Black IPA. Awesome!

Z butelki daje cytrusami niezbyt intensywnie. Zdecydowanie lepiej jest ze szkła. Słodko i owocowo, kawowo i czekoladowo. Jednak pod tym względem piwo jest najsłabsze. W smaku pierwsze wrażenie owocowo i cytrusowo. Później przychodzą suszone owoce, czekolada i odrobina kawy, która jednak utrzymuje się na podniebieniu przez dłuższy czas. Oleiste i bardzo gęste, pije się świetnie, jest aksamitne i bardzo gładkie. Piana wysoka, barwa czarna. Jest to zdecydowanie BIPA, a nie RIS czy Porter mimo niemałego woltażu (który jest odrobinę wyczuwalny). Świetny przedstawiciel swojego gatunku.

Butelka. Wygląd nieprzejrzyście smoliste, z gęstą pianą, pięknie zdobiącą szkło, jednak dość szybko redukującą się do obrączki. W aromacie ciemne owoce, jagody, borówki i mleczna czekolada. Wysycenie niskie. Goryczka średnia, bardzo przyjemna. W smaku kawa, pierniki, gorzka czekolada i wspomniane jagody. Bardzo aksamitne w odczuciu. Na finiszu zarysowany alkohol, przyjemnie rozgrzewający. Ogólnie jak na piwo degustacyjne bardzo pijalne. Godne polecenia.
Black with big brown foam head and lots of carbonation. Foam lasting, lacing. Strong coffee aroma and taste, nice balanced bitterness in taste. Long lasting. Nice. (Velp 201612)

Muy buena ipa negra cafetera pero sin abusar de este aspecto. Conuna espuma muy densa de color pardo y q se mantieneen el tienpo de degustacion.agradables toques frutales que no pasan desapercibidos en el suave y agradable amargor de una ipa. Con un punto salino muy interesante y un aroma muy penetrante a cafe intenso. El diseño de la botella espectacylar.una muy pero q muy buena cerveza. Agradable para una tarde de lectura y descanso

Aroma: good aromas of roasted malts, hints of alcohol, liquor, dark chocolate, coffee.
Appearance: almost totally black color. Very much above average head thickness and retention. Medium-to-High Brussels lacing. Beige foam. 
Taste: low sweetness, low-to-medium bitterness, very low sourness. Very pleasant taste of roasted and toasted malts, dark chocolate, pine, liquorice.
Palate: medium body, low carbonation, watery-to-oily texture, extremely long dry bitter finish of roasted and toasted malts, with hints of coffee, alcohol, hops.
Overall: very nice appearance, with good aromas of roasted malts and dark chocolate. Nice flavor and an amazing dry finish of roasted malts, hops, dark chocolate, hints of coffee and alcohol. Very well balanced beer. Not very much warming effect from the high alcohol level. Very good.
Just black. Thin, creamy head with a mocha colour. Aroma is a little bit of chocolate, salt, pepper, and perfume. Taste is chalky ground coffee. Lower carbonation.

330ml bottle. Pours black. Aroma is charcoal, sweet caramel, coffee, pine and some Parma violet perfume notes. Flavour is chocolate, lots of bitter coffee, lots of pine, some stone fruit and a little perfume. Really very nice.
Smells and looks like coffee. The taste is floral sweet and very dark. Finish is a little lacking and not enough coffee for me to notice it.
330ml bottle at old Beer Station, Xiamen on 2 Oct. Pours black with an off white head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Bittersweet finish.

Bottle from systembolaget. Aged a bit to mellow the hops. Pours nearly pitch black with a mocha head. Aroma is a bit hoppy at first with some citrus but quickly changes to roast, chocolate, dark fruit and liquorice. Taste is the other way around with dark chocolate, roast, liquorice and coffee ending with some citrus, grass and bitterness. Nice!

Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich, to empty the keg. Pours dark black. Yes, this is possible. Little but rather coarse and persistent foam. The grassy hops shine over the dark malts in the aroma and create an impressive harmony. Body is full with only a little carbonation, bringing forward the darkness. Some coffee flavour, yet not overly proudly shown. Might because its the end of the keg. Bitterness lifts the heavy veil upon swallowing. Very decent.

Bottle; pours nearly black with a mocha colored head; aroma of chocolate, roasted coffee, dark fruits, hops, and hints of vanilla; taste starts sweet with the chocolate and dark fruits; finishes with some bitterness; nicely balanced and delicious
Bottle 33 cl. Black with a medium lightbrown head. Aroma of coffee, hops, chocolate and some vanilla. Nice sweet taste with a soft long coffee and hop end, nice one.

A black IPA talán nem a kedvenc műfajom, az az érzésem, hogy a fekete szín ás az india pale ale sajátosságai nehezebben találnak egymásra, legalábbis a legtöbb esetben ilyen előjelek mentén vágok bele a kóstolásba. Szóval néha el-elfogyasztok belőlük egyet, de semmi több, mondhatni, az olyan darabok viszont, mint ez a mai, könnyebben változtathatnak ezen a hozzáálláson, olyannyira rendben van a főzet. Már a pohárba töltés során is látható, mennyire testes, olajos karakterű, hangtalanul siklik az üveg falán. Elsőre a szegfűs, karcosabb komlós hangulat tör elő aromák formájában, majd egyre komplexebb lesz az illatszerkezet, imperial portert idéző marcipán, stoutos pörköltség, édeskés kávé képe rajzolódik ki, majd simul mindinkább egybe. Szerkezete szinte tökéletes, olajos, haraphatóan telt és izgalmas, miután az illatjegyek által megelőlegezett tartalmat gond nélkül beváltja az ízvilág. Semmi élesség, csak gömbölyded ízjegyek, egyik komponens sincs túlsúlyban, klasszikusan kiegyensúlyozott alkotás. A sötétebb hangulatú, pörkölt malátafolyam és a komótosan hömpölygő komlószirup kirobbanó találkozása, így már számomra is érthetőek a pontszámok.

It pours black with a full brown head. There are aromas of coffee, citrus, and roast. The flavor combination leans towards citrus and floral elements with a strong backbone of coffee and roast. It has a medium body with a high bitter finish. There is a slight alcohol warming. It also has a slight creaminess to it. Overall, it is slightly balanced towards the hops, but complex flavors of the malts shine as well.

Nice, beige head, black colour. Aroma full of citrus, coffee, resin, roasted sunflower seeds, caramel. Hoppy. Taste is a mix of roast and hops. Coffee, resin, citrus, roast. Bitterness is medium to high leveled, very hoppy. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium carbonation. Body is full. Fantastic BIIPA!

on tap @ bens harbour
dark brown color with brown head. 
Aroma is sweet, coffee
Flavor is quite sweet and very bitter. Dry and bitter finish

Cena:  16,70 zł. 
 Kolor:  Czarny, od spodu szkła tylko delikatne ciemnobrązowe prześwity. 
 Piana:  Genialna! Ciemnokremowa, wysoka, hiper-drobno-pęcherzykowa, ubita i trwała jak na azocie. Musiałem trochę odczekać po pierwszym nalaniu, aby uzupełnić Tumbler kolejną porcją piwa. Bardzo powoli redukuje się. Pozostawia na ściankach szkła liczne firanki. Warto docenić tutaj pianę, gdyż lacing jest wręcz doskonały. 
 Zapach:  Ślicznie pachnie. Pierwsze skojrzenia są żywiczne, sosnowe, potem tony prażonego słonecznika.
Zaraz po tym subtelna paloność i odrobina kawy.
Nie brakuje tutaj również ciemnych owoców.
W dalekim tle przemknęła delikatna morska nuta, jakby odrobina słonej morskiej wody.
Po mocniejszym zamieszaniu szkłem znowu powraca żywica, sosna i słonecznik.
Aromat pierwsza klasa. 
 Smak:  Pierwsze nuty smakowe dotyczą bardzo dobrej jakości kawy, potem jest odrobina orzechów i posmak pianki na Cappuccino.
Dalej ogrom żywicznych, leśnych nut.
Stylowy prażony słonecznik bryluje na podniebieniu.
Jast także smaczna gorzka czekolada i spora doza paloności.
Szukam cały czas tych grudek soli. Odnajduję je po chwili oblizując podniebienie. Pozornie niewyczuwalne, osiadają na podniebieniu i dopiero po oblizaniu się czuć ten słony smak.
Po kilku kolejnych łykach zadziałała autosugestia i pojawił się posmak tych kryształków soli, które znajdują się na słonych paluszkach, czy też skojarzenie z obwarzankami krakowskimi z dużą ilością soli.
Niesamowite doznanie.
Warto zwrócić także uwagę na nieprawdopodobną wręcz teksturę piwa.
Trunek przypomina raczej gęsty czarny budyń, lub kisiel.
Ciało jest pełne, średnie wysycenie w stronę niskiego.
Doskonałe zatuszowanie alkoholu.
Przenigdy nie powiedziałbym, że to jest 10%-wy mocarz, na miarę niejednego RIS-a.
Perfekcyjne BIPA! Bez dwóch zdań Top3! 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie na niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Tu nie ma żadnej ściemy, tu jest wzorowe Black IPA w czystej postaci!
Imperialny czarny nektar wznbogacony o dodatki parzonej kawy i kryształków soli.
Doskonała uczta dla mojego podniebienia.
Piwo można oprawić w ramki i powiesić nad łóżkiem jako ideał stylu.
Balans poszczególnych składowych jest wręcz obłędny.
Cieszę się niezmiernie, że miałem okazję degustować to piwo.
Polecam każdemu i głową ręczę, że nikt się nie zawiedzie!

Refrigerated 0.33 L green bottle poured into a snifter. Black with medium beige head. Aroma is dark malt, medium/thick body, medium/lower carbonation, and thick small bubble lacing. Taste is dark malt, salty, and some herbal hops. More imperial stout than IPA for me, nice beer.
Very dark brown, thin bubbly head. Rich chocolate, pungent fruit, roast. Bitter chocolate, light fruitiness, just a touch of saltiness, sweeter but with a big, balanced bitterness in the finish.

From a 330ml bottle on 12/9/2016. Excited to discover this is the number 2 rated Black IPA on here. Pours not far off black with a medium head. The nose is pleasant but pretty mild, with some chocolate and caramel malt, and some fruity hops. Flavour wise, it starts out quite sweet with equal does of sweet citrus and stone fruit, and chocolate and caramel. This is met by firm, resiny hops, and the faintest hint of coffee, which give the brew supreme balance. The texture is a touch creamy and the carbonation is soft. A rare IPA that has definite dessert like qualities. Just lovely.

Flaske 0,33 l. Farge sort med beige skum. Lukt kaffe, sjokolade. Smak alkohol, kaffe, sjokolade, malt. En kraftig øl med tydelig alkoholsmak, fin bitterhet. Alt i alt en fyldig og god øl

Jet black pour with a single finger espresso head. Aroma has some caramel and hints of smoked malt. Lots of lace present. Taste is full of chocolate, bitter citrus hops, chalky roasted malt and a bit of phenol alcohol notes. Medium bodied.

Bottle at home. Black color, with a beige and persistent foam. Aroma is fresh cofee, roasting, dark chocolate and some nuts and vanilla. Caramel malt flavor base, toasted notes, dark chocolate and fresh coffee. Very mild bitterness, almost imperceptible alcohol. Creamy body. Very enjoyable Imperial Black IPA.

2016-08-27. Black body small creamy tan head and lace. 3++ Aroma of dusty fruity dark malt, light green hop touches. Pleasant herbaceous green notes come out more as it warms. Flavour is kind of rough to start just an odd combination of flavours, light roast and a slightly ashen quality. Smooth average bodied palate, soft carbonation. Odd. 7/4/7/3/14-15 On tap at Thin Man, Buffalo, NY.
Couleur brun foncé; mousse beige; arômes et goût maltés, de café, de chocolat noir et fruités; un peu liquoreux, mais lalcool reste malgré tout assez discret; finale moyennement amère et chocolatée

Coffee, espresso, dark chocolate, grassy hops. Bitterness is there but it doesnt explode like a normal IPA, so nicely balanced. A really, really nice dessert beer that is neither too sweet or overwhelmingly bitter. And drinks easily for the alcohol. Worth the hype.

On tap at Hopaholic, Budapest. Nose is roasted malt. Body is pitch black, head is big, beige, creamy, fully lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, light smoke, old wood, chocolate. Light sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Finish is long lasting hoppy and roasty medium to heavy bitter. Medium to full body, dry texture, soft carbonation. Easy dessertish beer, very tasty, perfect balance, great one.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 330ml bottle from 16th Street Liquor Store. Tasting with George. Pours a very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, toasted malts, hops, dark fruits, slightly salty. Taste is slightly sweet, chocolate, roasted malt, grassy, woody. Burnt malt, smokey, prunes, hoppy aftertaste. Excellent!

330ml bottle served in a pint glass. Pours a deep amber to brown color that forms a huge creamy and solid beige head with tons of soapy, creamy and molasses left in the glass. Nose is sweet, fruity and mainly followed by strong notes of coffee beans. Some chocolate, roasted malts, bready yeasts and earth. Sweet upfront taste. Strong notes of roasted malts, dark chocolate, dry dark fruits, brown bread. Strong bitterness punch, a mix of roastiness and grassy hops. Great bittersweet balance. Boozy notes in the very end. Full molasses body. Medium to low carbonation. Roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee in the aftertaste. Persistent aftertaste and bitterness too. Great drinkability to a such high ABV. New modality of beer, for sure an Imperial Black IPA. Masterpiece.

Flaska från To Øl Webshop. Svart med krämigt, fluffigt moccabrunt skum. Doftar kaffe, massa toffee, kola, granskott, stor humlebeska. Kaffe dubbel-ipa helt enkelt. Kroppen är något större, men ändå lättare än väntat. Kola, fudge och brända, rågiga toner smakmässigt. En viss känsla av kanderade mandlar med havssalt. Stor beska i eftersmaken. Snygg kaffeton som hänger kvar länge efteråt.

330ml bottle shared @AleBrowar Gdynia.
Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, raisins, some resin
Pours black with red reflexes and a dense and thick tan head.
Taste is coffee bitterness, finish is very espresso coffee like.
Minimal carbonation. Very drinkable. Could be at least a bit fuller for my taste though it would be way less drinkable then.

Kolor: ciemnobrunatny, lekko zamglony.
Piana: obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, zwarta, trwała.
Zapach: sporo aromatu kawy, ciemnych słodów, kakao, czekolady, lekko palony, obecne również aromaty chmieli, żywice, trochę owoców, delikatny alkohol.
Smak: średnia pełnia, również sporo nut kawy, ciemnych słodów, kakao, czekolady, trochę pralin czekoladowych, lekka paloność, wyraźne nuty chmielowe, średnia goryczka.
Wysycenie: średnie.

Aroma: coffee, citrus, roasty, caramel, alcohol, chocolate, spruce
Taste: medium bitter, light sweet, roasty, resin, spruce, coffee, caramel, dark chocolate
Very rich and well balanced on every aspect beer. Hopy and malty, beautiful head, pours dark black. The only disappointment is rather low feel of the coffee. Worth a second chance for sure.

Flaska från SB. Wow vilken BIIPA! Stora smaker, fin torr eftersmak och så snygga kaffetoner. Rostad smakbild men inte söt, rejält med humle som rundas av mot den mörka malten men som i beskan på slutet ändå drar längsta strået. Riktigt gott.

341 ml bottlw. Pours black with a thick, resilient beige head. Aroma is coffee, burnt, black chocolate. Flavor is coffee, black chocolate. Finish is meat, smoke, grapefruit, coffee. Lingering citrus and fruits. Medium body, sticky mouthfeel, weak carbonation.

Dark brown/black color. Dark malt, coffee, hop aromas of citrus and pine. Coffee tasting, roasted malt, citrus hops, pine, salt? A bit weird to add the salt, leading to a strange, bitter finish. Pretty good all around.

Brown bottle, 330 ml, best before 01/12/19, drunk at Lautre oeil, savoured on December 23 2015; eye: black, opaque, sheet of beige head that turns into a ring, no lacing; nose: stale, roasted barley, light hops, light anise, slight medicinal; mouth: stale, roasted barley, light hops, light anise, slight medicinal, coffee, acidity, salt, alcohol, alcohol warmth, cardboard, quite dry finale in coffee with presence of bittering hops, full body, average carbonation, mildly sweet, harsh texture; overall: disappointing
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Bouteille brune, 330 ml, meilleure avant 01/12/19, bue à Lautre il, savourée le 23 décembre 2015; il : noire, opaque, couverture de mousse beige qui se transforme en un anneau, pas de dentelle; nez : éventé, orge torréfiée, léger houblon, léger anis, très léger médicinal; bouche : éventé, orge torréfiée, léger houblon, léger anis, très léger médicinal, café, acidité, sel, alcool, chaleur dalcool, carton, finale pas mal sèche en café avec présence de houblon amérisant, corsée, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture râpeuse; en résumé : décevant

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a small sized head of foamy dark brown colored bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a opaque black colored body and a very good lacing. The mild aroma was black malt. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start mediumly tingly at the finish with a mellow roasted malt aftertaste. The flavor contained notes of black malt roasted malt velvety smoothness and malt. Delicious and one I would certainly buy again.

Tap at Hair of the Dog, Bangkok. Poured a clear dark brown with a thin broken off white head. The aroma is medicinal alcohol, coffee, dark chocolate, sweet malts. The flavour is strong liqourice bitter a rich roasty malt, light dry coffee, alcohol bitter palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

From tap at Mikkellerbar, San Francisco. Aroma of roasty malts, coffee and chocolate. Black with a fluffy soft foam. Begins with a medium sweetness followed by a light-medium bitterness. Taste of coffee as well. Not much carbonation, full body and creamy texture. A perfect and tasteful Imperial IPA!

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2016 Very dark brown with huge frothy/creamy brown head. Amazing and everchanging aroma of coffee, flowers, herbs, dried plums, chocolate, dark bread crust, nuts and the whole world. Tastes rather sweet with enough sourness to offset it, but roasty bitterness takes the top seat - it keeps rocking between those three until it culminates with crispy hoppy bitterness to linger for a long time. Thick yet creamy, with nice alco warmness that plays along with the taste really well. Simply marvelous!

Bottle, shared with thephantomhennes. Near black pour, brown head. Resinous pine, coffee, licorice, bitter chocolate, light capsicum. This packs a lot of complexity, but it somehow works extremely well. Delicious, full bodied.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle from Tanakaya. Pours a deep brown to black with a finger of head that lingers. Big roasted cacao nib nose with roasted coffee, salted caramel, earthy hops and more baked chocolate. Some marshmallow notes as it warms. Roasty and slightly sweet on the palate (but not as sweet as many of these types of beers can be) with a big dank, dirty weed notes with chocolate on the finish. Bitter finish. Super complex and solid. Very nice.

330ml bottle from BrewDog Online. Almost black colour, frothy three finger tan head, good retention, lacing. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, liquorice, hops. Complex and bittersweet taste with coffee, fruity bitter hops, grapefruit, liquorice, dark chocolate. Smooth oily texture, bitter finish. Fantastic beer, the flavours work so well together in this. Great stuff. BB 11/02/21

Draught at Mikkeller Barcelona. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with coffee, nuts, hops, roasted malts, vanilla, licorice and a bit of salt. Bitter finish with roasted malts, hops, nuts, vanilla, licorice and chocolate. Exquisite imperial black IPA.

Bottle. Opaque black color with light brown head. Aroma has coffee, roasted malt, tropical fruits, dark chocolate. Taste is malty sweet with long bitter and quite dry aftertaste. Flavors of roasted malt, tropical fruits, citrus, coffee, ash, dark chocolate. Complex and somehow very strange one as the tastes are so mixed but still so good and well-paired.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2016 Mooi donker bier met romige crèmekleurige schuimkraag die goed aan het glas blijft plakken en langzaam wegebt. Hoppig aroma met toetsen van koffie, mout, klein beetje vanille (?), beetje drop. Zoete aanzet. Vol en halfzwaar in de mond. Afdronk licht Koffie - bitter. Zeer zacht voor een bier van 9,9 % abv. Alcohol zit zeer goed verstopt. Perfecte balans. Topbier !!

0,33l bottle at home from Firmabier. Pours black colour with moderate thick head, lasts in the glass for a while. Aroma of roasted malts, lots of dark coffee, some chocolate and caramel, bitter hops. Medium body. Pleasent coffee finish.
Helt svart med lysbrunt skum. Kaffe, grapefrukt og karamell i duften. Frisk kaffe, mørk sitrus, intens bitterhet og et tilstedeværende alkoholpreg. Koseøl.

pours pitch black with big thick brownish head, aroma is roasted malt, some cardboard, taste is roasted malt, hoppy citric notes, some fruityness leds to a bitter coffee finish with some piney citric and florals notes, full creamy, soft carbonation, lingering bitterness [11/02/21]

375 )I think), capped. Im not sure if weve gotten more bottles of this in the States since last summer, but it seemed somewhat likely that this was not the freshest bottles--and it was still rad for sure. Pours an opaque matte black with a thin but creamy tan head that sticks around for a while. Big earthy dry baking chocolate nose. Not much hop character (thats what makes it seem like this might not be the absolute newest bottle around). Coffee there, some roast, maybe some toasty black bread crusts. Lively carb and a full body; beautiful chocolatey toasty dry mid palate washing into a beautifully dry finish. Really a nice beer that Im eager to try fresh now for sure.

W aromacie z jednej strony słodowo: kawa, czekolada, popiół, jakaś nalewka, z drugiej chmielowa rześkość, cytrusy, które dochodzą do głosu po przelaniu do szkła. W wyglądzie lita czerń z beżową czapą piany, zdobiącą szkło. W smaku uderza potęga kawy niczym w espresso, do tego deserowa czekolada, gdzieś w tle majaczą cytrusy, na finiszu kawowa kwaskowatość. Ciało dość gęste, wysycenie dość spore. Początkowo charakter bardziej stoutu niż ipy, ale nadaje to temu piwu pewnej szlachetności, momentami nasuwają się skojarzenia z risem lub porterem bałtyckim, tylko te buszujące w tle chmiele przypominają, że to jednak ipa. Z czasem jednak dochodzi do głosu żywiczność i grejpfrutowa goryczka, które pod koniec dominują w tym piwie. Bardzo bogate w doznania black ipa, świetnie łączące kawowo-czekoladową słodowość z żywiczno-cytrusowymi chmielami. Do tego niemal 10% alkoholu jeszcze uszlachetnia ten trunek

Nice light Brown head. Lasting long. Hoppy nise quite fresh. Jet back body. Thick in mouth. Complex taste of hoppy flavour and roasted malt. As usual I like what they do at To Øl!  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Vraiment particulier. Amertume du café avec un côté salé. Zeste de citron. Tire St Catherine salé. Plus chocolaté, mélasse et malt au nez.
Mörkt brun, på gränsen till svart öl med ett stort ljusbrunt skum. Doften är klassiskt svart IPA med både citrus och mycket rostade toner. I smaken tar det rostade över nästan helt.

Pours a dark brown, almost black with a medium off white head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Taste is similar with hints of vanilla and a very slight saltiness. For 9.9% it is a very easy drink and one to savour every drop. Excellent!

Copenhagen 29/5 2016. 33 cl bottle from Gunnar Madsen Vinhandel. Quite abstract label with flowery patterns reminding me of painting I would find at my Maternal Grandmothers apartment. Pours opaque black with creamy light beige head. Settles as thick creamy crown of foam with good lacing. Intense aroma. Sweet as caramel, brown sugar and vanilla. Bitter as coffee and dark chocolate. Fruity streak in this cornucopia as well. Soft carbonation and oily palate. Flavor is balanced between intense sweetness and quite pronounced bitterness. With the bitterness winning out. Quite bitter aftertaste staying with you. Quite overwhelming - in the very positive meaning of the word.

33cl bottle at home. Hazy (very) dark brown with a medium tan head. Medium to full body with low to moderate carbonation. Quite bitter with subtle sweet tones. Coffee, dark chocolate, pine, spices and brown sugar. Good!

Przepięknie prezentujące się piwo, nieprzejrzyście czarne z fantastyczną czapą piany, która odmierza na szkle każdy łyk. W smaku mamy zarówno owoce tropikalne i cytrusowe, jak i nuty czekoladowe. W smaku jest równie przyjemnie, piwo mimo swoich parametrów jest niesamowicie pijalne, alkohol kompletnie niewyczuwalny.

from Au Trappiste - pours a very dark brown beer under a creamy long lasting beige foam; nice lace; fairly roasted aroma of coffee, licorice, vanilla and black cherries; full-bodied, tasty and lively, solidly bitter, dry; long coffeish aftertaste with notes of ashes and licorice - great!

Very dark brown or black colour, nice beige head and lacing. Aroma is a combination of strong hoppiness - mostly mango and grapefuit, intensive coffee and some dark malts. Beer is medium-dry, a little sour from dark malts and coffee and a little salty, I feel that the salt should increase sweetness but it doesnt seem that way. Biterness is medium and it has qualities of both hops and coffee. Alcohol is present, but not too agressive, nice and complex beer.

Bottle at home. Has a black colour with a huge khaki creamy head. Roasted aroma with lots of coffee, ash, smoke, wood, dark chocolate and some grapefruit in the background. Rich taste with lots of roasted malt, coffee, ash, dark wood, very dark chocolate and grassy hops in the end. Has a slick and silky mouth feel, full-bodied and solid bitterness. A very tasteful and aromatic ale. Well roasted and quite bitter. Lot more stout than IPA in this.

330ml bottle, trade with Skinnyviking. A creamy, fawn-coloured head resting over a near-black coloured body. Crocheted lacing. Smoothly roasted malts on the nose, hints of coffee and molasses. Burnt dark malty flavours joined by moments of dark bread, salty liquorice, molasses and coffee. Roasted endnotes. Fine bodied. Lovely beer, had expected even more though (Tromsø 04.05.2016).

W nosie kawa, paloność, likier kwawowy, w tle delikatna ziołowość i cytrusy. Czarne jak smoła, nieprzejrzyste, super zbita, beżowa piana. W smaku bardzo złożone, kawa, czekolada, karmel, paloność, cytrusy. Wyraźna strona słodowa, ale przez kontrę kwaskową od palonych słodów piwo nie jest zamulające. Goryczka spora palono- grejpfrutowa. Dużo ciała, olejiste, kremowe, wysycenie niskie, alkoholu prawie nie czuć. Klasa. Kran w KiK.

33cl bottle, served in Tulip glass. Pours black with medium beige head. Good lacing. Aromas of coffee, citrus, roasted malts and caramel...smells so special. The flavour is very unique as well: coffee, citrus and earthy hops, chocolate, vanilla...really complex. Pleasant bitterness on the palate along with the roasty touch, everythings in haromny. No alcohol presence at all. Body is almost full, carbonation is perfect. Awesome one!

Superb hoppy aroma full of citrus, grapefruit and earthy malt. Pours dark with a tall head. Tastes coffee, chocolate, grapefruit. Works really well. Full bodied, feels slightly oily, wonderful and long after taste. Fantastic beer

Praticamente nera, con ampia schiuma marroncina, abbastanza compatta ma con tante piccole bollicine. Un bel aroma di malto tostato, caffè, cioccolato. Bevuta davvero piacevole e scorrevole, amaro piuttosto contenuto, malto, tostatura, caffè, accenni di liquirizia e legno. Chiude lunga. Carbonazione medio bassa. Corpo pieno, intensa, alcol presente ma non invadente, si beve con facilità. Molto buona soprattutto lato malto, manca solo un pelo di amarezza in più.
Catchup rate from BD AGM2016. Black with tan frothy head. Roasted coffee and chocolate. Light hops. Bitter earthy coffee. Ooof!

33cl bottle. Very dark brown pour with a soft tan head. Smells salty, with notes of brewed coffee, citrus hops and chocolate. Taste notes include coffee, milk chocolate, roasted malts, pine, grapefruit and salt. An excellent Black IPA, one of my favourite.

Tap sample at Tallinn Craft Beer Festival. Brownish black with little creamy white head. Nose is coffee, hoppy grapefruit and sweet, almost sugary. Tastes roasty, sweet, coffee and hoppy bitter. Wheres the salt? Should try again.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2016 On tap at hopaholic. Very dark brown almost black colour, medium brown microfoam. Nose is roasty woth marshmallows in the background. Taste is medium to high bitterness. Strong notes of cocoa and coffee. Not much of the hoppy notes Id expect from a bipa, but very nice nontheless. (Had it in bottles, didnt like ot that much)

Bottle - it's a super dark pour....black as motor oil with a med to thin tan head. Dark aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and a hint of hop in the background. Layered flavors of bitter chocolate, rich coffee, peat and subtle bitter hops.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2016 On tap at la caisse de Bieres un Courbevoie. Pours a short beige to brownish head with very finely roasted malts aromas. Fine carbonation and bubbles. Oil black body. Very fine in mouth with long palate. Perfect in Many aspects and especially the malts. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. The pour is a medium to light black with a nice light tan head that falls to a film and bubbly collar and leaves quite a hearty lacy behind. The aroma is full is biter roasted malts at first and then the coffee moves through nicely. Its a little single dimentional, because I was hoping for more bitter roast and strong hop. But the coffee is a nice addition. Its just lacking something. The flavor is a collection of light items. The roast is definitely present, and there is a little hop, but for the most part, its disappointing. There is a hint of coffee, light roast and hop bitternesses, and its not what I was hoping for. The mouth feel is thin and watery with a roasty bitter aftertaste that has a little chocolate. The carbonation is a little light and off, but oh well. Its not quite a drop off from the nose.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is earthy hops, coffee, crazy roasted malt, pine, very robust. Appearance is dark dark brown, light brown head. Taste is coffee, bitterness, roast, pine, earthy hops, there is nothing really happening here. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, watery, roasted malt and pine aftertaste. Overall, this is incredibly disappointing.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: roasted and caramel malt balanced with grassy and hoppy nose. Small salty caramel and toffee finish. Taste: full body with roasted malt and coffee notes. Chocolate powder notes. Toffee caramel with grassy hops. Very intensive taste. Good attenuation and quiet drinkable. Aftertaste: grassy hoppy with wet bitterness roasted malt and chocolate.

Tap, TCBW 16. Dark body, medium head. Aroma is roasty with coffee notes, the hop aromas are less dominant. Taste is mostly roasty and has coffee bitterness instead of a big juicy hop bitterness I expected from the best Black IPA in Europe. A bit unusual for a BIPA but generally a good dark ale.

On tap at TCBW 2016. Almost black liquid. Sticky beige froth. Very nice coffee taste with notes of berries. Tangerines in the middle. Citrussy, bitter finish. Really nicely balanced DIPA with coffee accent.

Bottle courtesy of euro Summer Santa. Thank you! Held on to this like it was an Imperial Stout rather than a BIPA. Well see if that was the right thing to do. Pours blackish dark brown with a big frothy and creamy beautiful looking dark mocha head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of sticky lacing and trace on the glass. Smell is malty, slightly fruity, slightly grassy and slightly earthy with roasted malts, burnt caramel, grapefruit juice, tangerines, unripe mango, moist grass, dark roast coffee, resinous wood, moist soil, salty liquorice hard candy, orange zest and lemon zest. Tap at Tallinn Craft Beer Weeken 2016, Tallinn. Colour is black wit brownish white head. Aromas and flaovurs: Fruits, citrus, hops and malts.

Intense aroma of chocolate, coffee, tropical fruits. Black color, beige head, nice lacing. Taste is sweet, medium bitter, alcohol in the aftertaste, light coffee. Light to medium carbonation, smooth. Very good.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Hoppy smell with some hard bread, light coffe and dark malts in the background. Hoppy taste with a dark malty backbone, not roasted though. Very nice! The ABV is well hidden.

Bottle, Brewdog Leicester. Black with a beige head. Dark chocolate with toffee and vanilla. Coffee with dark berries and burnt wood. Bready with spritzy lemon. Spicy with underlying gooseberry. A bit of funk with melon and white grape. Dry cocoa nib palate. Very good.

Tap at TCBW. Dark brown beer, small tan head. Hoppy nose, spice and coffee notes, roast. Flavor is a nice mix of coffee and hops, grapefruit. Spice and roast in the finish with grassy and citric notes. Very nice.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar, Barcelona. Pours black with dense beige head. Aroma of coffee, some dark chocolate, some notes of tropical fruits and roasted notes. Tastes bitter with some sweetness, smooth mouth feel. A good one.
chocolate, nuts, roasty, resin, basement aromas, licorice, black, clear, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, umami, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
Sellaane. Kahvi IPA pojun musan päätteeksi. Koko lailla jykevää on. Hyvää erityisen.

330ml bottle. Pitch black body with a massive tan head. Tons of lacing. Citrus and coffee hits the nose, followed by roasted notes and some alcohol. Flavor is roasted and fruity with citrus, alcohol, liquorice and some salt. Sort of a soft mouthfeel and easy to drink despite the abv.

Marrom bem escuro, turbidez intensa, espuma marrom de ótima formação e persistência. Aroma carregado de malte, media torrefação, licor de cacau, café, lúpulo mais presente com o aumento da temperatura, complexa . Paladar de médio dulçor e amargor torrado, leve salgado, álcool muito bem inserido. Corpo licoroso, baixa/média carbonatação. Final mantém o malte torrado, café, sabor persistente. Muito boa.

F: creamy, brownish, very good retention.
C: dark, non-transparent even against the light.
A: roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, light pine resin, citrus, floral, grassy.
T: huge coffee/malty tones, toasty, black chocolate, expresso, lingering citrus/floral/earthy bitterness on the palate, hint of woody, tobacco, leather, smokiness, salty/grassy tones together, licorice, full body, low carbonation, sure great BIPA worth to try, 0,33l bottle from Malting Pot in Brussels.

Bottle, 330 ml from Svijet Piva. Shared with JFK10000. Pours black with medium light brown head. Coffee and piney hops in aroma. Roasted malts, coffee, bit fruity, medium to heavily hopped. Lasting bitter finish. alcohol well hidden. Great one.

They have managed to balance a black coffee stout and an imperial IPA in one beer. Nothing is too strong, nothing is lacking. Coffee, chocolate, caramel, roasted malts, but also pale malts and fruits, both sweet and fresh. Light acidic and sweet at the start, finishing in bitter. Truly the best of all combined!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Almost black color with huge tan head. Aroma is roasty, citrusy, zesty, piney with notes of coffee an dark chocolate. Taste is strong hoppy, zesty, light roasty with chocolate and coffee, dry hoppy finish, salty aftertaste

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Pitch black with mid sized beige head. Caramelly nose with some coffee and citrus. Sweet with full body and clean, hard mouthfeel. Saccharine dominates, some caramel and coffee. Inky finish with more saccharine. Lifeless and unbalanced.

Mörk brun med ljusbrunt stort skum som lämnar gardiner på glaset. Doftar kaffe, mörk choklad men här finns också typiska dofter av amerikansk humle. De första smaksensationerna är kaffestout men sedan kommer all humlen med sina citrustoner och tropiska frukter. Skapligt välbalanserad svart IPA, men denna hybridstil är inte riktigt min stil.
Drank 17-3-2016 while writing in my diary. Best black IPA Ive ever had. Good hoppy taste in the beginning, followed by a very good soft, stout-like taste, awesome.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Black with a tan head. 
Roasted, fruity, grassy aroma with some coffee. 
A bit alcoholic. 
Liquorice, cold coffee, fudge in the flavour. 
Rather high bitterness.

Bottle from local SB cons 2016-03-10 Göteborg
AR: fat black chocolate, wee roasted malt, some tropical fruity marmalade wee bit of odd poo when poured 
AP: dark brown, frothy creamy light brown foam, crazy curtain pattern
F: thick fluid, warmingvchocolate feeling, dry, bitter, wee tropical fruity, tar, tobaco, wee brittish popcorn with some dugsr, salty liqurice, sopat mouth feeling, grainy, long and lasting finshes black chocolate and a bit to much tar...

Aroma is is thick and roasted malts with a hefty dose of coffee notes. Theres a slight hoppy sensation if you struggle a little, but make no mistake, the coffee is in the drivers seat here. Taste delivers on all levels. A rich and full taste from the roasted side of the palette, soft-ish sweeter malts with wee notes of salty liquorice, dark cocolates. It never really turns over to be a "stouty" brew, so I guess the hops are there doing their job really well? The coffee continues all the way through, never letting you go completely, and turns up in the end as the sole survivor. Marvelous brew this one.

Black with a small creamy beige head. Truly a fusion of styles.. This has the mouthfeel of a creamy stout, the fullness in flavour and also the fruity middle of the ipa. This is ballanced and just works nicely. Best black ipa Ive had.

0.33 l bottle from Firma Bier, best before November 2020. Clear, very dark red to black with a medium large, creamy, stable, light brown head. Sweetish, roasty-malty and slightly fruity aroma of chocolate, cocoa, hazelnut and tropical fruits. Sweetish, roasty-malty and fruity taste of dark chocolate, cocoa, licorice and coffee, followed by tropical fruits (mango, orange and some grapefruit) and finishing with a medium long, roasty-bitter, still hoppy-fruity and resiny aftertaste with lots of coffee and licorice. Medium to full body, thick and creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Impressive and intense stuff, the opposite of quaffable, but at the same time very tasty and satisfying. Good!

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av humle, kaffe, karamell, mörk choklad , rostade malt med toner av lakrits och citrus. Lagom sötma, viss sälta, torr, väl dold alkohol, beska med smak av grapefrukt och tall.

The foam is growing nicely and you can see how everything is built up from the ground and becomes a nice beige / brown foam crown with small & medium bubbles. The beer is a dark brown color that is almost black. The beer has a sharp smell of roasted coffee and hops tones. There are even some tropical fruits, grapefruit, citrus, etc. The tones of caramel malt, saltine crackers, rye bread. Many lovely aromas of balanced enjoyment. Starting with a strong small bitter espresso coffee with notes of milk chocolate. Then follow the bee little lemon and grapefruit which again goes into a roasted coffee flavor. The beer feels grassy and earthy. The aftertaste is a little dark chocolate tone with a bit of dark berries and brown sugar before the end with bitter roasted coffee again. Awesome lovely balance and aftertaste takes just over before it becomes too much and instead elicits the desire to enjoy more.

Pours black with medium light brown head
Aromas of coffee, dark fruits, brown sugar, choxolate, cwramel malts
Taste has chocolate, coffee, hoppyness of tropocal fruits, caramel, rye bread
Medium to full body, medium bitter, low to medium carbonation

Tydlig doft av ljus choklad och lättrostat knäckebröd, väldigt besk smak med viss choklad. Inte alls balanserad tyvärr. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Trevlig doft. Kaffe och ljus choklad. 
Lite för besk som förstår. Tyvärr inte en hit.

330ml bottle pours black in color with a finger and a half of light brown head that retains well and leaves some nice lacing on the glass. A 330ml bottle with a best before date of 1st December 2019 and poured into an oversized wine glass. The beer poured an opaque black colour with a really nice two finger brown head with good retention but leaves wonderful stringy lacing. It eventually settles to a creamy thin layer. Initial aromas are of bready buscuit malts and espresso coffee followed by tropical mango and pineapple fruits. Maybe even some liquorice at the end. Taste starts strong with bitter espresso coffee, slightly smoky with a hint of dark chocolate which then turns fruitier with dark berries followed by citrus grapefruit before ending with bitter coffee again. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. This was really good as it has a very balanced yet complex aromas and flavours and of course coffee flavours. The 9.9% ABV is well hidden and it just goes down really easy. It is a must buy beer in my opinion.

Teku poza wymienionymi już wcześniej nutami w aromacie pozwala wyczuć znacznie więcej chmielowości  zwłaszcza mandarynek i grejpfrutów, ale co ciekawe pojawia się też tutaj dosyć wyraźna gałka muszkatołowa. Pierwszy łyk daje momentalne odczucie gęstości, gładkości i wyraźnej słodyczy, choć w bardzo długim posmaku przechodzi ona w coraz wyraźniejszą goryczkę, w której chmielowy aspekt jest wyczuwalny, ale rządzi jednak kawa  szlachetne i kwaskowa. Alkohol genialnie ukryty. Obecności czekolady i rodzynek w smaku można się doszukać, ale pod warunkiem, że się temu piwu poświęci trochę czasu, nieco nad nim pokontempluje. Bo takie właśnie jest to piwo  wybitnie degustacyjne, niebezpiecznie zbliżające się w stronę RISa

Almost pitch black, strong and very lasting creamy tan head with amazing lacing skills. Alcohol well hidden. Full bodied, light carbonation and resiny.

9.9% ABV. Black coffee IPA.
Nice creamy layer of light brown bubbles.

Unctuous malty nose, nicely alcoholic, redolent of stewed fruit, honeyed figs and sweet dates.

Sticky honey on the tongue right away. Mead-like mouthfeel. Thick and syrupy. Light carbonation. Good hoppy finish with proud bitter hops help to balance the malty gravitas. Surprisingly light experience for what is advertised as a black coffee IPA and drinks like imperial stout or strong monks ale. The hops are what gives it away since the overall palate is hop-balanced.

Other flavor notes predictably evoke descriptors like toasty, roasted, caramel, chocolate, treacle, peat, tobacco.

There is a fair bit of alcohol in this expertly brewed experience, but you hardly notice it given the clear hop presence appearing at just the right time to perform cleansing palate duties fastidiously.

Deep yellowish beige, thick and moussy, lacing head over a black liquid, leaving only a faint impression of dark mahogany around the edges. Complex, inviting aroma of espresso and roasted coffee beans, bitter chocolate, pine wood, whisky, caramel, dried plum, cream, some smoked meat and fried bacon, drop (liquorice candy), leather, blood, black pepper, Cuban cigar tobacco, cloves. Dense and demanding taste profile, starting off with candied figs, raisins and walnuts, subduedly sweetish with a clear salty touch persisting till deep into the finish (Im beginning to hope this is the familiar hops saltiness I remember from all those IPAs and not the symbolically added body sweat salt...); soft carbonation with thick, fatty, creamy mouthfeel, pointy sourish accent appearing as well but remaining quiet, after which a deep maltiness unfolds, with layers of bitter chocolate, nuts and caramel, becoming ever more coffee-ish towards the end, with a fairly strong and somewhat perfumey retronasal effect of dried spices (especially liquorice) and dried fruits, finishing explicitly but complexely bittering and drying, with peppery, earthy and resinous hop bitterness blending with a coffee-like, mouth-filling roasted maltiness, a subtle hint of smokiness as well as a hint of warming, liqueurish alcohol and lingering caramelly malt sweetness. Complex and quite severe, this is a lovely salty-bitter, fascinating brew, the taste of which will remain with me for quite a long time. Nevertheless, seeing its score here, I cant help having expected a bit more from it and its just a tad too salty for me to fully enjoy its complexity - but still, a great piece of work.

Aromat - wyraźnie cytrusowo-tropikalne z kawowo-czekoladowym tłem. Dużo mango, marakui, różowe grejpfruty. Trochę mniej, ale i tak wyraźna czekolada deserowa i minimalne akcenty słodkiej kawy. Barwa czarna nieprzejrzyste. Niesamowita piana. Drobna, beżowa, wręcz azotowa, bardzo wysoka, sztywna, obfita, długa. Jest nawet efekt lawy, jak po nalaniu z pompy. W smaku zaskoczenie - odwrócenie akcentów! Dużo czarnej kawy, sporo gorzkiej czekolady, śliwki i wiśnie w czekoladzie, praliny. Jest też trochę świeżego tła: tropiki, cytrusy, łodygowość. Alkohol (9,9%(!)) nieźle ukryty, ale wyczuwalny w przełyku. Fajna, kawowa goryczka.

Piwo jest czarne, nieprzejrzyste z bardzo piękna pianą. 
Aromat nie jest intensywny, ale bardzo złożony. Wyraźne zapachy żywiczno-sosnowe i słodkich cytrusów. W tle kawa i gorzka czekolada. Spod tego wszystkiego subtelnie pojawia się alkohol.
Smak to na początku gorzka czekolada (nie z tych 100% kakao) i ponownie kawa. Następnie pojawiają się żywiczno-sosnowe nuty chmielu. Finisz to wyraźna i mocna chmielowa goryczka, a po ogrzaniu lekko alkoholowa - rozgrzewająca gardło. Każdy łyk pozostawia bardzo przyjemny posmak mocnej kawy espresso. Piwo jest bardzo pełne i gęste, wręcz oleiste.
33 cl bottle 9.9 % abv. pitch black with beige head. fresh and bitter with slightly burned coffee notes. spicy too. Very drinkable.

Great coffee presence. TOØL has this style down pat. Great smell. Great bitterness taste. It's a ballsy beer with a great nose and good mouthfeel. The price is bad. $10.99 for a 12oz. bottle! Great for a coffee beer but there is better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black. Aroma and taste are roasted coffee and chocolate followed with piney hoppiness.
I love a good black IPA and this certainly is one. Smokey grapefruit bitterness (if that makes sense) with plenty of coffee thrown in. Strong stuff.

Draft. Small tan head atop brown-black body. Aroma is moderately sweet, roast, some grapefruit, coffee, light alcohol. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some roast, coffee, light alcohol warming. Smooth medium-full body, low carbonation.

Gift from Marcus. Pours very dark brown with no head. Aroma of dark malt, coffee, and strangely floral perfumes. Full body or nearly. Flavor is dark malt, some odd, and firm, perfume/floral flavors, and hints of coffee. No chocolate that I can discern. And then I can discern. Theres a strange mouth impact that suggests very, very mild wintergreen. This is strange and invigorating flavor profile. I lack the words to describe.Quite pleasing tho.

330 ml bottle @ Haandverkerstuene May 2014. Dark brown, almost black body with a nice, dense brown head. Wonderful aroma with dark, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, lots of citric fruit and grapefruit. Flavor is sweet, dark roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, citric fruit, grapefruit and nice bitterness. Fine body and a long lasting, pleasant aftertaste with sweet roasted malt and fruity bitterhops. Nice one.
Pours black with beige head. Aroma is roasted, chocolate and hoppy. Flavour is roasted, spicy, coffee, dark chocolate and hops.

Black with stable head. Incredible aroma of coffee, sunflower and citrusy notes coming from hops. When it comes to taste it gest a bit worse as alcohol could be better hidden. The bitterness is high and well balanced with malty background.

Black color. Big creamy tan head. Medium intense aroma is hops, roasty malt and coffee. Taste is hops bitter, dark chocolate and coffee. Aftertaste is dry coffee bitterness, hint od alcohol. Medium to full body, low to medium carbonation. Nice and complex beer.c

12.7 oz bottle. Thanks Bobby D. Black pour. Light tan head with thick bubbles. Smell is euro hops. By that I mean ok. But not exactly fresh, but logistically not really possible to have at the peak of freshness. Taste is hoppy with kind of a dry stout malt base. 


I know it says coffee on the label, but Im not convinced they put any in there. 

Decent? Yes. Top 200 beer? No way.

37.5cl bottle from GCM pours with a nice deep dark body that supports a full firm tall mocha colored head. The aroma offers up chocolate sweetened dark roasted coffee, some earthy chocolate and then mild hoppy notes of pine mixing nicely with dark chocolate. The taste begins smooth and silky as sweet malts and molasses sweetened dark roasted coffee slowly give ground to ever growing chocolate and dark chocolate goodness. To midway it gets more nectar and oily like with fairly intense sweetened coffee and growing pine hop resiny and chocolate infused grapefruit hop bitterness. Around the edges of the experience lurks slivers molasses and toffee. I dont think Ive had a somewhat chocolate and coffee forward Black IPA before. This one does the trick. Yet another great offering from this stellar brewery.

Zawsze mam obawy, kiedy sięgam po piwo uznane przez innych za rewelacyjne. 100/100 na ratebeer - tłum nie może się mylić... Jednak wtedy oczekiwania są wysokie i nie zawsze jest tak jakbym chciał... Kiedy zobaczyłem piwo w szkle już byłem zadowolony - piękna, czarna barwa i świetna wysoka, pomimo dużej mocy piwa, piana. I ta barwa! Beżowa - piękna! Cudowny zapach kawy i cytrusów zachęcał do jak najszybszego pierwszego łyku. I tu nastąpiła chwila zawahania, gdyż przez moment smak nie zrobił na mnie wrażenia! Dopiero po chwili, gdy przez przełyk przeleciała kolejna porcja trunku, było świetnie. Tu kawa przerodziła się w mocne espresso, a moc piwa objawiała się tylko poprzez przyjemne pieczenie w gardle. Nie wyczułem soli, która miała być tu dodatkiem... Na koniec ważna sprawa - rewelacyjna, zrównoważona, niezalegająca goryczka - wszystko niemalże idealnie! Świetne piwo.
Black of color with a brown head. An aroma of roasted malt, minerals, coffee and weak burnt. A dry flavor with roasted malt, coffee and liqurice.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 04/12/18, 100 ocena na RB :) Super wyglad - bardzo ciemne, brazowo czarne, ledwo ledwo przepuszcza troche swiatla, na tyle, by byly refleksy brazowo-miedziane. Idealna piana - bujna, drobnopecherzykowa, opadajaca powoli, ladnie zostajaca na szkle. Aromaty bardziej stoutowe, chmiele graja tu drugoplanowa role. Czekolada, kawa (gorzka i aromatyczna, espresso, espresso doppio, duzo kawy), palonosc, sliwki w czekoladzie. Troche jakichs piernikowych nutek. Z chmieli zywicznosc, grejfrut, duzo delikatniej. Smak kawowo-czekoladowy, lekko kwaskowaty (wraz z wzrostem temperatory ta kwaskowatosc z palonych slodow rosnie). Faktycznie przy kilku lykach wrazenie gdzies tam na granicach percepcji soli. Goryczka niemala i bardzo pozostajaca - wraz z kawowymi posmakami - na jezyku. Wysycenie dosc wysokie. Dosc pelne. Nieco oleiste. Ciekawy efekt przy ogrzewaniu sie - aromat coraz slodszy (bardziej czekoladowy) podczas gdy smak coraz bardziej kwaskowaty i palony. Sumarycznie: ewidentnie klasa piwo, pokazujace, jak rozlegla jest definicja Black IPAOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottiglia 33 cl
Colore bruno scuro, quasi nero, con un bel cappello di schiuma color nocciola, pannoso, persistente non molto a lungo. Gli aromi di malto tostato e caffè sono molto intensi al naso, con frutta secca e acida(prugne) e legna bruciata alla fine. Stessi aromi riproposti in bocca, ben presente il caffè, dosato in maniera originale e perfetta. Sfumature di carciofo al palato, immediatamente prima del luppolo che conquista il palato, ancora insieme al caffè. Corposa al punto giusto, carbonazione medio-bassa. Finale secco (anche se dopo un po arriva una leggera e piacevole astringenza) e lungo, complesso. Il sale marino crea in bocca un senso di movimento, che quasi ricorda i mari del Nord.
Birra di una complessità tale che la bevuta è una continua ricerca di sapori e sfumature. Splendida

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2015 Bottle. Pours pitch black with a generous coffee coloured head. Head reduces gradually with a lot of lacing left around the glass. Aroma is mainly of hops, pine, little bit of the roasted malt and coffee. Taste is initially of dark malts, chocolate, nice hit from the hops, more pine, little bit citrusy. Really nice long finish with the espresso dominating. Loved this a lot. Light carbonation, smooth mouthfeel, medium to heavy body.
330 ml. bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a nice tan head. Aroma of malt, pine, and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, pine, coffee, chocolate, and coffee. A lot going on here, and it works!

Bottle from Brewdog, Nottingham.

Black....Huge head, tan coloured.

Coffee and Chocolate on the aromas. On the taste, Coffee, pine, caramel, earthiness, roast nuts,

Bottle at home. Very dark brown colour, beige cream head. Roasted malty tones like bitter chocolate and cacao, milky coffee and caramel and piny, citrus and tropical fruity hops. Also some red and dried fruits to be noted, vanilla too; especially as it warms. No boozy burn despite 10° abv. Especially the balance between flavours with the velvet soft (!) mouthfeel is impressive. Light and dry aftertaste. Medium carbonation, good body.

Black (stout) liquid with 1 inch of medium-brown head, moderate-to-fine coarseness, a bit frothy, moderate-to-slow rate of decay to patchy, appealing film that stays. Aroma is sappy pine, some black coffee, some grapefruit peel, hint of caramel (but difficult to discern under the strong flavors here.) Medium-to-medium-heavy body, gritty-oily, moderate carbonation with moderate-to-intense burn. Flavor is sap, earthy bark, evergreen, bitter fruit rind, some dark coffee (particularly on the exhale.) Big bitterness that doesnt linger long. A touch of caramel. Overall, an excellent BIPA with a coffee presence that is understated. Perhaps a bit too bitter for me.
Chocolate, coffee and hops on the aroma, with a salty hoppy finish, very easy drinking. So well balanced.

Pours a very dark brown with brown thin head and roasted coffee and little hoppy aroma. Little heavy body with taste like coffee in the middle and lightly bitter at the end. Very well balanced beer. Great beer.

Poured from 330mL bottle [M.H.T. 04/12/18]. Black with light tan head. Roast malt and coffee with a little chocolate in the background; Some sweet citrus hops and subtle floral kind of salt. Very well balanced - no flavour is predominant, but none clash either, quite harmonious.

-Short review- Black with very nice tan head. Good lacing. Aroma is american hops, coffee and molasses. Fruity and round palate. Aftertaste is well balanced between hops, roast and salt. Overall: Very nice and interesting. Not too much aroma.
Bottle. Black with tan head. Aroma or molasses, fruity licorice, pine and coffee. Taste of pine and coffee with some licorice. Full body with a bitter finish. Solid

Bottle from the local Vinmonopol enjoyed at home
Pours black with a huge creamy brown head. Smell of roast, coffee, citrus, pine, dark malts and toast. Moderate sweet, dark malts, coffee and tons of roast, touches of citrus and pine. Heavy bitter finish, resins all the way. This is a world class BIPA, its intense in all ways, both the roast and hops are fighting agressively to show off. Excellent stuff
more big hoppy stout or porter than IPA. Really nice roasted malt character. Piney hops with a little earth and citrus, with the coffee rounding things out gently. Nicely done.

Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, smooth coffee, espresso, dark chocolate, fruits, orange peel, hops. Flavour is moderate sweet with a long bitter finish. Deliciously aromatic, potently flavoured and extremely well-balanced. The best Black IPA Ive ever had. A work of art.

Black in the glass. Muted coffee aroma with a hint of citrus hops. Wow... just wow... clean burnt pizza crust (in a good way) followed by a hint of citrus hops and more toasted malt. As it warms in the glass, it morphs into a more fruity brew; citrus, pineapple and mango poke their heads above the surface enough to be detectible. Just perfect. No hint of the 9.9% alcohol either. Very well done! Overall, an amazing beer. Tastes just like slightly burnt pizza crust but in a highly desirable way.

Aroma: coffee, sweet malt very inviting
App: black tan head made of large bubbles with sheet lacing 
Flavour: intense dark malt with great hop and balanced coffee 
Palate: long malt finish with some sharp coffee and quality hop
