375 ml bottle into tulip glass, no bottle dating. Pours fairly pitch black color with a 1-2 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice dense soapy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, light char, floral, grass, and floral/roasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of citrus/pine hops, roasted malt, and coffee notes; with good strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, light char, floral, grass, and floral/roasted earthiness. Moderate amount of pine/roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, lemon/orange zest, pine, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, light char, and floral/roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/pine hops, roasted malt, and coffee flavors; with a great bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, fairly creamy/sticky, and lightly chalky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent Imperial Black IPA. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/pine hops, roasted malt, and coffee flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

Pours almost black with brilliant beige head. Aroma of black malts, honey, some citrus, pine notes and delicate coffee scents. Taste is well balanced. Sweetness on the front is immediately covered by bitterness of dark malts and coffee taste. Through the palate you can feel nice pine and citrus notes. Definitely pleasant bitter finish.

Bottle.
Pitch black pour, small tan head. 
Very hoppy nose, crisp malty taste, followed by a sweet finish, hints of coffee.
Full body, soft carbonation.

Pours a deep dark brown, thin sustaining head. Pine, floral hop driven nose finished with a hit of freshly brewed coffee. Bitter citrus flavour and coffee thru the middle of the palate till finish. Well balanced, abv and ibu sit very well together and drive home a very good bipa. Good stuff

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of strong coffee, roasted malts, raisins, alcohol. Taste is medium sweet, bitter, coffee, dark chocolate, alcohol present, raisins. Nice long coffee finish.

A deep dark IPA with a thin mocha head. In aroma, chocolate malt with floral and resinous hops, grapefruit pulp, alcohol warmth, nice. In mouth, loads of bitter chocolate with good coffee grind, musty character, floral and resinous hops, alcohol warmth, very nice. On tap at Beer for Geeks.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2015 This is the perfect beer. An amazing representation of the style. The balance of roasted malts, pine, coffee and bitter hoppy finish. I would punch, any man or woman in the dick, that told me they didnt like this beer. Or at least tell them theyre a silly porcupine. Legendary!

Complete black color with medium retention layer. Pine, sweet malts, roasted coffee, dark chocolate and fruits on the nose. Same character as the aroma has the flavour. Medium/ full bodied and bitter/coffee aftertaste. Incredible!

Bottle 33cl, A dark beer with medium head copper head. Nose is intense on on dark chocolate and hops resin. Aroma is very malty, sweet, chocolate like, coffee, creamy, hops resin, candied apricot, peppery hops, lot of licorice, robust body. Finish is again very resinous, sweet, bit massive.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2014 Pitch black color, average sized brown head. Aroma of hops, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, flowers. Medium to full body, lively carbonation. Taste is similar: chocolate, coffee, citrus, spices. Medium sweetness with quite strong bitter kick. Strong stuff.

Bottle 33 cl.
Hazy dark brown, tan head. Roasted, bread, hoppy, malt and hints of coffee. Medium sweet, roasted dry finish.
Gran cerveza, perfecto balance entre una Imperial IPA y una Stout. Aromas a caramelo y lupulos, rn paladar predomina el amargo mazclado con el cafe. No se sienten los 9,9º.

Bottle 0,33l, bought at Hoppiness in Koper (Slovenia). Dark rich liquid with tan soft foam. Full body, light carbonation. Creamy, taste of coffee, touch of grapefriut and herbs. Complex, well balanced. Great one.

Deep brown body with a light-brown, creamy head that reduces to a decent layer that laces the glass well. Perfectly balanced and very strong aroma of tropical fruits, grapefruit, lots of chocolate and other roasted elements with fainter coffee in the back. A bit surprising that the chocolate is more evident than the coffee... The strong flavour is more hop-driven than the aroma, with initial notes of tropical fruits and grapefruit and more subdued roasted notes of coffee and chocolate. In the long-lasting quite heavy bitter finish I get plenty of pine and flowers. The sweetness is light to moderate, the body is full, the texture is creamy and smooth and the carbonation is moderate to soft. A fantastic BIPA!
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 4 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]
Aroma of the gods, dark and ominous, yet influential and bright. Id buy it again in a heartbeat and damn the expense.

Bottle (forgot where from) consumed at home Thursday 6th November 2014.   Pours black with a creamy head. Very smooth gently roasted lilting coffee aroma. A bit of heat in the mouth but unsure if this is just the alcohol or perhaps it us the chilli I just chopped. This is creamy, soft, with oodles and oodles of coffee and fresh hops. A truly marvellous beer.  A8 A5 T9 P4 Ov17 4.2

Pitch black color with a decent beige head with medium retention. Aroma is plenty of coffe and very juicy, also grapefruit, orange peel, tangerine, pine and some chocolate hints. Medium bodied. Taste is a bomb, full of coffee beans, grapefruit, tropical fruits, citrus and hops. Aftertaste is halfway between roasted and bitter. Extraordinary!

13/X/14 - 33cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: 13/V/19 (dafuq?) (2014-1213) 
Clear dark brown beer, big creamy irregular beige head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: sweet caramel malts, dried fruits, piny, bit roasted. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: some caramel malts, pretty sweet, dried fruits, bitter hops, citrus, nice piny touch. Aftertaste: roasted, bit of coffee, bitter hops, sweet malts, honey, bit grassy, citrus, exotic fruits.

12 ounce bottle thanks to Christian. Pours a jet black color with a medium brown head. A big pine fruity hop nose. The flavor is more rich pine, coffee, roast, metal, bigger huge fresh citrus and pine. This works well. Its big but drinkable. A lot like my beloved Dubhe. Lovely.

Pours thick and dark brown like a coffee. With a thick tan head that leaves complete lacing around the glass. Aromas are of roasted coffee, toffee and some citrus and spice from the hops. The taste profile can be broken down into 3 distinct phases: the first is a nice bitter hop kick (citrus and fruit) followed by a syrupy coffee sweetness that has a slight breadyness as the sweetness dies off it enters the 3rd phase of a bitter salty chocolate linger that I never want to end. Medium carbonation, with some molassasy thickness and a little tickle of heat in the sinuses from the 9.9% ABV, but the whole thing balances out like Philippe Petit on a tightrope between the Twin Towers. A life changing experience this one.

(330ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Oct 31 2014) Dark with a huge tan lacy head. Aroma has powerful dark roast coffee, semisweet dark chocolate, slight citrus undertone, little earthy, fresh pine boughs. Palate has nice fruity citrus or even tropical notes highlighting a sweetish dark malt core, but a huge helping of dry dark roast coffee, slightly charred, with woodsy earthy notes help wipe the fruity sweetness out. Moderate to high slightly resinous hop bitterness lingers along with the coffee roast in the dry and ashy finish, a little hint of fruit from the hops remains. Moderate slick body with medium carb. Super pairing of coffee and big imperial black IPA characters, the coffee helps keep the beer quite dry and bitter and even slighlty astringent at times but it never tastes overly burnt. Very drinkable for the ABV. Dont pick up much salt, dont care, this is pretty much a perfect black IPA.

33cl bottle @ home. Pours very dark brown with a large and creamy 
tanned head that leaves lacing. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt, grapefruit, pine and a little alcohol. Flavour is bitter and sweet from the hops and probably also the coffee. Full bodied, fitting texture and average carbonation. Finish is medium bitter with a long coffee aftertaste. This is a perfect example of how a black ipa should be.

Flaska (tack NordicV). Svart öl med fint beigt skum. Dofter av kaffe, rostad malt, lakrits, frukt, choklad och kåda. Fantastiska och väl sammansatta smaker av kaffe, lakrits, tobak, kåda, citrus och choklad. Stor kropp. Avslutningen är mjukt bitter. Läcker!

Bottle at home. Black pour, thick foamy tan head. Aroma is roasted, creamy, coffee, licorice, chocolate, sea salts, some tobacco and quite spicy. Flavor is smooth roasted bitterness, slightly creamy sweet and a hint of salt. Huge body and very well balanced. Nice brew.

Svart som natta med medium/høyt skum. Aroma av lakris, mild granbar, mild sjokolade, kaffe og litt fruktige toner også. Smaken er hovedsakelig kaffe, med røstet malt og frukt også. Humle i tillegg. Lun og litt søt munnfølelelse, før den blir behagelig bitter på vei nedover halsen. Medium konsistens.
Pours a very dark brown, black in the snifter. Lacing of head. Strong dark hops smell. Very smooth, strong hops but cut well with the coffee. Lingering hints of hops on the palate.

Bottle poured into Teku glass. Pitch black with tall, beige and stable head. Great lacing. Appearance of this beer is just perfect. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, some roasted notes, lots of fruits and citrus. Taste has this fruity-like sweetness at the beginning and heavy bitter (but pleasant) finish. Its really drinkable, especially considering high ABV. Medium carbonation, quite full body and nice, smooth mouthfeel. Great stuff.

Coffee, chocolate, wood, fruits and citrus in the aroma. Black with a tan head. Medium sweet and medium to heavy bitter. Full body with a soft carbonation. Bitter and dry finish. Overall a really nice Black IPA, lots of flavours of roasted malts and a nice fruity bitterness.

33cl bottle from Vinmonopolet, Vika. Pours black with a beige head. Roasty and fairly hoppy aroma with coffee, dark chocolate, citrus, pine, licorice and some herbal and fruity notes. Medium sweet with lots of flavours, but well balanced. Finishes quite bitter and the aftertaste is fairly long and pleasant. Delicious stuff!

Bottle. Pours black with a big off white creamy head. Aroma is hoppy pine and orange peel, as well as lots of dark malts with coffee, cocoa, leather and liquorice. Medium to full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour has an initial bitter hoppy attack with pine and grapefruit, as well as yeasty earthy notes, and burned malts with nice, sweet and mellow coffee, wooden barrels, vanilla and muscovado. Sweet dark malts and coffee in the finish.

Bottle, 330ml. A pitch black beer with a small brown hue at the top and a small white head. Aroma is of grapefruit, orange zest, lemon, pinewood and hops. Taste is bitter with some carbonation and astringency. Heavy roasted malt character, but well-balanced with the hop flavor. Strong finish and somewhat alcoholic that reminds me a lot of mint. Nice black IPA.

Bottle, 355ml. Opaque dark brown with a frothy brown head. Sweet roasted aroma with hints of citrus, dry fruits and coffee. Medium bodied with moderate to high carbonation. Sweet with moderate bitterness and a sitinging alcohol and bitter finish. Very pleasant, but overwhelmingly sweet and minty. Ive defintely had better Black IPAs.

330 ml bottle from Gradi Plato. Very dark brown, pretty much black looking, with a nice, creamy and persistent light beige head. Good lacing. Roasted and toasted nose, not much hoppiness, at least not strong enough to dominate the aroma. Bitter dark chocolate, a hint of espresso, some darker berries type of fruits, perhaps some traces of soy sauce and vanilla in the background. Nice lousciois and velvety smooth mouthfeel, extremely drinkable considering the big ABV. Not much bitterness to it, light astringency and a rather big sweetness which is perfect to balance the warming and slightly alchoolic presence. Lingering roasted and chocolaty aftertaste. Soft to average carbonation, medium to full body, oily texture. Surely this is a old bottle, so the hops may have faded quite a bit. In a way similar to the Buxton Imperial BIPA, but much more enjoyable, imho. Seriously great.

33cl bottle. Dark brown colour with a thin tan lacing. Roasted coffee, dark chocolate, brown sugar, caramel, pine and fruit in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium to full body. Taste is a complex but more bitter. Overall, a very good beer.

Bottle shared by a friend. Dark brown pour with a thin tan head. Aroma of malt, roast, light coffee and grassy hop. Malty and caramelly flavor with some chocolate before a bitter coffee and hop finish.

Bottle. House of Trembling Madness bottle shop, York. Clear, dark brown. Solid, lasting, sticky, tan head. Dark chocolate. Bonfire toffee. Light roast coffee. A big stump of pithy, grapefruit bitterness on top. Taste is coffee bitter, and citrus bitter. Palate is lighter that expected. Fairly smooth, though. Finishes ashy, cocoa dry, and long bitter. A bit at odds. Could still drink it everyday, though.

Dark brown to black in colour with a light tan small head. On the nose aromas of roasted malts, coffee, roasted almonds and some dried plum, pine and light fruityness/orange/quince arises. The palate offers a light carbonated slick texture with flavours of sweet-bitterness with some light acidic/salty notes. Excellently balanced fruit, malt and coffee notes intermingle and build to a very pleasant lasting finish.
Una cerveza bien equilibrada entre el amargor natural de las IPAs y el tostado de las "blacks" ademas con el toque de sales que no deja indiferente.

On keg at Brewdog Leeds late 2013. Rich coffee in the nose, roasted malt, piney and citus hop coming through but balanced very nicely. Thick body, oily palate, average carbonation. Very drinkable, could not believe this weighed in at almost 10%

Bottle from The Beerhive. Dark brown body with a large beige head. Great lacing. Aroma of coffee, salted caramel, brown sugar and boozy fig. Flavour leather, acidic espresso and black currant. Hides the alcohol well. Medium body with a sticky mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Incredibly drinkable for a 9.9% ABV beer, but not as complex as I was expecting.

Apperance: dark brown/black with wonderful, beige head that lasts very long and leaves beautiful lacing. Aroma: citrus, ping, cocoa, coffee and caramel. Taste: impossibly perfect mix of citrus notes coming from the hops, fruity ones from the yeast and chocolate with grains ones from the malts. Great, strong espresso and bitterness in the finish. Perfection in a small bottle. Respect for To Ol!

Bottle, 0.33l. Cloudy black color with thick creamy brown head and very nice lacing. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, grapefruit, berries and tropical fruits. Taste starts refreshing fruity, but gets quickly overpowered by rich and sweet roasted malt with coffee, chocolate and salty notes. Its well balanced with hidden alcohol level, mouthfeel is spicy, warming and mouth-coating, while finish is moderate bitter with long coffeeish aftertaste. Full body, oily texture and soft carbonation in palate. Sweet lord, thats awesome crossbreed between salty dog and bitter bastard :)

Bottle. Jet black pour with a frothy tan head. Burnt malts, some peat, exotic fruits, vanilla, some alcohol burn, coffee and chocolate. Somehow this weird mix of flavours comes together and actually tastes good. Good stuff!

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2014 Pours an opaque black, with a mocha head. Smells of chocolate, freshly ground coffee and piney hop aromas. Taste is coffee, bitter dark chocolate and a tang of chili and salt. This beer is quite viscous, its like drinking a strong coffee and dark chocolate milkshake.

Aroma: coffee, caramel, cocoa, milk, pine, citrus, chilli, red fruit, biscuit; Appearance: dark brown, minimal foamy head; Taste: medium bitterness, medium sourness, slight sweetness; Palate: slick texture, medium body, astringent finish, average carbonation
 Perfectly hidden alcohol, delicate coffee stout in the beginning with a slowly submerging hoppy-citric kick. Fine and rather dry, for connoisseurs. Sip slowly.

Very nice french coffee, initial taste is that your drinking a stout and then later you realise its an ipa. It alternates between the coffee and the ipa which I always think is a bit disconcerting, its very nice but Im not a fan of black ipas really, I find more I dislike then I like, really for hubby who adored it, dark, carbonated, head, lacing, bottle at bottle shop.

Perfect Imperial Black IPA with coffee. Outstanding look, wonderful aroma and magnificent taste. Full of citrus, tropical fruits and pine. Additionally - with bunch of coffee and chocolate. Perfection!
Bottle at home. Black with a brown head. Aroma heavy malty (roasted, burnt, coffee) and hoppy. Flavor medium sweet, medium+ bitter. Medium+ body.

Very black and thick tan head. Huge aroma if coffee, pine hops, spruce, cookies, some raisin, yet fresh ingredients as well. Wow, Im impressed! Super smooth, strong bitterness and roasted flavours. Refined? Not the right word, but its not overdone for my taste. I love it! Just my kind of beer! (33cl bottle from A la bière comme à la bière)

The best Black IPA ive ever had. Aroma of citrus, coffee, pine. Also a bit of pleasant alcohol (like red wine)
Taste is great balance between fruity hops and malts (coffee, dark chocolate) Oily texture. Drinkability is very high, alcohol is well hidden. 
Perfection.

Good aromas of caramel and dark malts. Hard bitter and salty taste. Heavy bitterness that fills out the sides of the mouth for a long time. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle shared with Vestergaard. Pours black with a thick off-white head. Aromas of some settled hops, some orange peel, citrus, slight smoke, roast, coffee and some licorice. Slightly boozy. Taste is pretty sweet, roasty, malty with a very subtle smokey backnote.

Bottle, thick black pour with a nice finger of dense creamy mocha head. Aroma is roasted malts, skunky hops, coffee, and ainse. Taste, wow lots going on with this brew, medium mouthfeel, roasted malts, followed by bitter hops, then a wallop of coffee with a semi dry roasty finish. This is really good, the coffee blends effortlessly with the BIPA, if you are a coffee fan you will enjoy this.

Pours a cloudy dark brown brew with a big beige head with regular to poor retention, aroma is moderate to heavy bitter and moderate sweet with chocolate, coffe and citrics, medium to robust bodied, flavor is bevy bitter and moderate sweet with a bitter finish and a long aftertaste, good balance, very good black ipa
Jet black with a rich brown head. Coffee, dark malts and a hoppy bitterness. There is a ton of huge flavors that should conflict, but they have managed something that lets them all shine.

(Bottle). Sweet but also crisp taste of figs, alcohol, roasted malt, granulated sugar, tropical fruits and hops. Large and strong taste of coffee with smooth but prominent element of roasted malt and hops. The flavor ends with a nice hoppy bitterness, taste of chocolate and warming alcohol. Well balanced flavors and a very nice beer.
Deep muddy brown pour with brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, molasses, cane sugar coffee. Big and rich roasted malts, piney bitterness and warm booze finish. Nice.

Pours opaque, deep, dark brown. Aroma of roasted malt, mild coffee, dark chocolate, and a bit of citrus - pleasant but not terribly unique. Flavor is more interesting, containing the aforementioned elements but with a deeper chocolate, piney hop bite, lingering bitterness, coffee on the finish, and I do believe a bit of saltiness. Bitter end with a slight burn. Nice!

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2014 kolsvart med stort ljusbrunt skum. Doftar rostad malt och massor med kaffe! Kaffet dominerar smaken men även malt, humle och lite choklad. Ganska tunn för att vara 9.9% men riktigt bra!

Dark brown color with some red underones - lovely, sticky and beige head. Sweet aroma with hints of both coffee, ripe and dried fruit, licorice, citrus and flowers. Creamy texture, low carbonization. Aroma is dominated by black coffee and floral and citrusy hops.Hints of both licorice, caramel, roasted malt and dried fruits though. Nice beer indeed

33 cl. bottle poured in to a Tulip. Hazy dark brown colour bordering black with a creamy, tanned head. Citrus aroma as the cap goes off - then roasted malts with caramel, chocolate, coffee, liquorice and pines. Some grapefruit and peach. A hint of sea salt. Taste is bitter and roasted. Medium to full body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and roasted with rich, roasted malts, liquorice and coffee. Very rich and delicious B-IPA.
Bottle. Pours dark brown tan head. nose/taste of fresh coffee, roast chocolate, pine, salty earth and resin. Medium body.
On tap at Mikkeller and friends, Copenhagen. Black pour with a beige head. Chocolate, blackberry and licorice aroma. Dusty-dry flavours of blackcurrant, salt, some citrus and sweet malt. Intriguing.

Bottle from drinkshop.sk Very dark chestnut brown color with huge off-white head. Roasted malt, aromatic hops in aroma. Taste, dark malt caramel, overlapped by citrus hops. Long hoppy bitter finish. Tasty.

Flaske fra vinmonopolet kolbotn. Svart farge, lite/moderat karbonert, lys skumtopp. En svart ipa med mye kaffesmak, brent malt, brunt sukker, humle, grapefrukt. En Utrolig god og velbalansert øl. Merker nesten ikke bitterheten og at det 9.9%

Bottle. Nice dark brown nearly black body with brown lasting head. Aroma is first of a Ipa after some times it changes to the aroma of a stout. Taste is pine coffee vanilla and dried fruits. Aftertaste is smooth coffee with some cocoa. I cant believe that this is 120 Ibus. Very nice one.

Appearance is very very dark brown, almost black, with a 2-3 finger mocha-coloured foamy head which persists throughout. Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Very delicious. Super light and fresh avec mons tongue. A nibbly bite of hops, with a painted staircase of smooth intense mocha coffee. Does not taste nearly 10% - remarkably well done.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2015 Bottle. AWESOME LABEL - best ive seen! Pours dark dark brown, lets no light through. One finger light brown head with great lacing. Aroma is hoppy with loads of simcoe. Medium smooth body. N1. Warming, but no notice of the alcohol.

On bottle at Sandefjord Ølfestival. Pitch black, some offwhite foam- high viscosity. Roasted aromas, hops , coffee, licorice, leather ; high intensity . Full body & high complexity . Solid bitterness - good balance . Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a very dark brown with beautiful lacing. Aromas of sour coffee, pine, roasted malts and vanilla. Taste is chocolate, espresso, and roasted malts. Wonderful cross IPA and coffee stout. Beautiful!

Bottle from Kitsilano Liquor, Vancouver; bb 04/12/18, batch 440Black color with generous brownish head. The aroma of fruity, perfumy beer is perceived as soon as the cap is removed, so typical of these Danish contract brewed beers: some coffee and roasted malt. Robust but lean body, if thicker it would be an Imperial Stout; the flavor profile starts with an Imperial Stout, strong roasted malt, some coffee, a bit salty, hints of liquorice; and then a powerful hopping, very resiny, but that also offers fruity sides; moderate residual sweetness. Ends with traces of alcohol, warming.Solid, flowery. Very good.

Very complex aroma of english hops and, obviously, coffee, nut and dark chocolate. You can see its two souls well distinct each other: the IPA hoppy herbal resiny one and the "stouty" one which, for some reason, go together so well. A good attenuation makes this beer so drinkable though its alcohol content and its mellow velvety texture. Every single sip is different from the following one: its an american stout, its an IPA, its an american stout, its an IPA and so on... The aftertaste is that of an imperial stout: a bit astringent, some caramel and long lasting. Guys, this beer is a little masterpiece! Its so simple using pounds and pounds of hop for an IPA, whats hard is finding the right balance between hops and malts and To Øl has found a perfect unassailable formula. Its a 10/10 or thereabouts.

This works best a little warmer for me. Initial coffee heads towards funky hops and heaps of coffee and boozy warmth in the background. Some woodiness. Cola. Great frisky palate. Moving into chocolate and dry hop burn. Up there with Wookie Jack.

Bottle - Coffee and pine hops, with a ton of roast. Jet black with a rich brown head. Coffee, dark malts and a hoppy bitterness. There is a ton of huge flavors that should conflict, but they have managed something that lets them all shine. Well done.

Cool odd duck. Long-lasting head, lots of lace. Aroma is malty and perfumey. Slight hint of the coffee in the aroma. Coffee comes out in the flavor. Great body. A few small off flavors in the e aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown with full tan head. Aromas of sour coffee, pine, roasted malts and vanilla. Flavors of pine, limes, chocolate, espresso, and roasted malts. Maybe some saltiness or just getting this from the name? Lively carbonation and lingering bitter finish. Great cross IPA and coffee stout.

Botella de 33 cl en casa de cimmeria. Tomada el 24-06-2014,, en el momento. (fecha cons pref para 04-12-2018). Color marrón muy oscuro casi negro con espuma beige oscura persistente. Aromas Intensos de maltas tostadas, quemadas y abundante café con toques especiados y vainillas sobretodo. Cuerpo medio, cremoso, con 9.9 vol perfectos, fácil de beber. Sabores maltas torrefactas combinadas con un amargo seco y algo herbáceo pronunciado, mezclado con toques dulces de la azúcar moreno, vainillas y el final de café también pronunciado. Según etiqueta::: agua, malta, copos de avena, cebada tostada, lúpulo, azúcar Cassonade oscuro, levadura y café... un autentico regalo de black ipa con café francés... Muy buena, cremosa y refinada con especias y cafés suaves pero intensos con un amargo correcto, todo ello bien duradero en boca,,, para repetir sin duda de nuevo.

Lasting frothy off yellow head atop an opaque black body. Nose of burnt coffee, soya sauce and bitter hops. Flavour is a mouthful - full bodied, deep coffee and pine hops, mild vanilla and milky yet bitter finish. Very enjoyable. Purchased at Metro Liquor University Heights for $5.50/330ml bottle.

Draught

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Intenso color marrone scuro con cappello mediamente spesso di schiuma marroncino chiaro. Sentori abbrustoliti, fruttati, esotici, di cioccolato, di biscotto, di espresso; gusto amaro e luppolato con note di frutta passita, cacao amaro, malto e caffè, finale lungo e generosamente tostato, leggermente erbaceo. Corpo medio, effervescenza gentile, buona persistenza; sorso dopo sorso si fa sempre più vellutata... Fantastica!

Bottle at BottleDog, Kings Cross first tasting on 12 Jun. Poured black, with a dense beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, prunes and molasses. Grassy hop bitterness in the flavour, with some coffee and liquorice. Dry finish with some, straw and burnt toast; very rich and rounded. Great beer!

Strong coffee notes with some rich dark chocolate flavour thrown in. The richness makes it taste more like a porter to me with not enough hoppy bitterness to be an IPA. This is not a criticism as this is a beautiful beer that gets better with every mouthful. As close to an Arabica Espresso that you can get in a beer. 

Rated by BrewTom
Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is malt, roastiness, herbs, some coffee and quite fruity. Taste is medium to high sweet leading to a roasty and fruity finish. Excellent.
Wow. Very light burn. Heavy taste almost creamy. Too strong but not in taste. Weal coffee taste.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle @home. Pours black with a beige head. Soft coffee aroma, hoppy. Taste is hoppy, coffee. Light to medium bitterness. Dry and bitter finish. Nice one.
Nose is sea weed, chloride, stale espresso, damp clothes, feel is fat, taste is medium licorice, some earth, decent espresso, later mediumdry hops bite

Svært farve med beige skum. Lukt av røstet malt, bek, kaffe, sjokolade. Smak av røstet malt, lakris, kaffe og sjokolade. Bøker & Børst.

Nydelig duft av bek, kaffe, lakris og sjokolade. Dyp mørk farge, nesten sort. Tykt lag brunt skum som reduseres til tynn hinne, heng langs kant. Nydelig fruktig smak med kaffe, lakris og mørk sjokolade.

Wybitne, wielkie piwo. W aromacie nuty alkoholowe, chmiel, zioła, potężna dawka gorzkiej czekolady i kawy, czuć ponadto spaleniznę - jakby dym unoszący się w zimie z komina wiejskiego gospodarstwa - coś przyjemnego :) . W smaku dominuje wspomniana gorzka czekolada, goryczka jest wyraźna i niezalegająca, ma w sobie coś z porteru bałtyckiego z tym ze tutaj wszystko dzieje się nagle. Huge brew. Very complex aroma dominated by pine, spruce alike hops. "green" on nose it is. Taste is massively bitter from hops and a bit from coffee and malts with black malts sweetness throughout. Flavor is so full, throughout loaded with herbal, pine alike hops. Close to full body, thick texture, soft carbonation, long bitter finish. And those tiny, intimate salt touches in flavor are beautiful, complementary. Must try sample.
Chocolate, coffee and citrus aroma. Taste is coffee, red wine, chocolate . Finish is long rich and bitter.

Bottle. Poured pretty much black with a nice pale tan head. Aroma of roasted coffee, light smoke, slight herbs, vegetables, pine. Flavour has more coffee roasted malt bitterness in the main, low to medium hops, quite sweet, herbal, tasty fo sho but something just not perfect.
Aroma: kafija, auzas. Sals tumigs kafijains, bet nav oarsatinaats. Loti labs pie ediena butu

Hoppy lightly roasted aroma. Black with large very long lasting brown head. Medium sweetness & lightly bitter hops. Medium body, thick texture, soft carbonation & lightly bitter finish with touch of smoke.

Poured jet black with mocha head. On 1st look it reminded me of an imperial stout. Citrus hop aroma with a mixture of coffee and chocolate. Tastes of citrus hops and lots of coffee. Its like the brewer mixed a really good ipa with a really good imperial stout and ended up with this amazing beer!! Highly recommend this

Bottle at Nya Tröls. Wow, truly impressing beer. Coffee and loads of it with some dark chocolate, a raisin and chocolate-sweetness together with a saltiness thats hard to describe and puts this beer into the next dimension.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2014 On tap @ Chmielarnia in Warsaw. Lovely aroma: mixture of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts and hops. Velvety taste - citrus fruits covered with chocolate and espresso. DWF; Pours dark brown, leaving lacings, tan head. Aroma is light roasted malt, caramel, pine, tropic and citrus fruity.Taste is light sweet, mostly bitter and lasting. Balancing. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft.

0.5 flaske på Cardinal. Mørkt skum. Aroma av humle og kaffe. Smak av malt humle og kaffe. Vekdig god. Balansert

I wasnt a big fan of black IPAs until now. This is definitely one of the best beers Ive ever tried. Aroma is amazing, hoppy, fruity, but also a bit smoky, roasty. Taste - this is a festival of hops and black malts. So well ballanced. So much is going on. Dark-fruits and citrus, coffee, vanilla, chocolate. The aftertaste is really long and just fantastic.

Bottle 6 at Tool Tasting Night from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with a frothy tan head, pine and roast malt aroma, taste has big fresh pine hop, along with dark chocolate, roast malts, quality coffee, some dark fruits and a big bitter finish.

the combination of coffee and hops are very well integrated in this beer, nice dark color with a mocha colored head. great mouthfeel with substantial sweetness backed up by a awesome bitterness. definitely a beer to sip on.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2014 Bottle from Maltbazaren. Pours black with a nice beige head. Aroma mixes hops, citrus, coffee and malts effortlessly. Taste is mainly coffee with bitter hop notes in the end, making it a very drinkable piece of beer somewhere in between an IIPA and an imperial stout. Loved it. - with thirst, Niklas

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends, february 14th 2014. Black body, thick beige head. Aroma of coffee, citrus, toffee, grapefruit. Taste is roasted coffee with lots of fruity hops, not too sweet giving it a crispy play with the hops and coffee. Leaves a good tropical fruit and roast finish. Very well crafted!

Body salts, hva blir det neste? Stemningen rundt bordet denne 2.påskedags aften på Cardinal ble med ett lyrisk. Uhyre lettdrikkelig for sine 9,9 karbohydrater og bør inngå i en hvliken som helst 5-2 diett. den kan også inhaleres. Rett og slett imponerende.
Beautiful hop flavors on the nose, complemented with strong malt presence. Mouthfeel is incredibly well-balanced with perfect hoppy finish. Probably the best Black IPA you will ever have.

Bottle. Black pour with creamy tan head. Aroma is complex with notes of coffee, chocolate and sweet malt. Taste has intense coffee but is still very well balanced. Significant bitterness. Ends quite bitter as well. Nice composition with very subtitle indications of the high ABV

Shared bottle at Cardinal. Black body with a fingerthick cappucino colored head that leavea good lacing. Vanilla milk shake and pleasant roasted notes and a hint of ashtray on the nose. Sweet alco warm, light ashy roasted coffeenotes. Medium bodied and smooth. Roasted finish.
Ebony with beige head. Aroma of dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate and citrus. Wonderful taste. Lots of bitter coffee. Grape fruit. In both taste and aftertaste.

Shared bottle at Cardinal. Pours all black with a nice looking creamy tanned head. Aroma of floating lovely liquorice,light roasted malts. Taste is moderate sweet , roasted malts, liquorice, smooth and creamy mouthfeel, nice and very moreish.

Fantasic brown head, tar black color. Bready malts, coffee, ripe fruits, mango, peach, a whole lot going on in this, while fruit aromas are the most present.

Taste is much more defined by coffee, as the smell actually promised. Coffee is so intense, it reminds me of espresso, providing a bitter, dry beginning. Bitter chocolate and earthy malts support the bitter, present coffee, providing a underlying sweet- and earthieness. Fruits are also present, giving the beer a great complexity. Fruits turn more and more recognizable, as the palate adjusts to the beer. Surprisingly, those two very different tastes go very well together. Bitter from the beginning, fruity hops add a lovely piny, sweet note to the beer, with a gentle bitter, hoppy ending. Mouthfeel is almost a little oily. Great melange, full bodied, neither coffee nor fruits seem to be too present on their own, which makes this beer so great for me. Both sides of the beer would work perfectly fine on their own, but thrown into one single bottle, a unique enjoyable taste is created. Very smooth, warm, gentle, while alcohol is detectable at no point.

Bottle frae Brew Dog. Deep dark brown pour with a head. Roasty toasty beak with plenty of coffee and notes of new car tyre and berry. Similarly roasty flavour with choc, cocoa and smothered hop. Theres just a bit too much coffee here, and the hops are rather overwhelmed as a consequence. Ok but not my favourite offering from this otherwise excellent crew.
375 mL bottle. Black in color with a good sized tan head. Aroma is of roasted malts, pine, earth, herbal, and coffee. Taste is of coffee, roasted malt, light booze, pine, light earth and herbs.

Bottle. The look is black in color, tan head, and super dark. The smell is malty, coffee, chocolate, hops, burnt, super nice, and pine. The taste is pine, bitter, hops, malt, roast, chocolates, coffee, and good.

375 ml bottle. Bottled Nov 2013, about 5 months old. Pours black with a huge pillow head that fades slowly and leaves chunky lacing. Appearance is awesome with some patience. Aromas are sweet milk chocolate, fresh coffee, pine, light berries, and dark bread. Taste is intense. Starts sweet with chocolate and caramel. Changes to coffee and thick dark bread. Finishes with some piney bitterness but the aftertaste still brings a malty sweetness. I think I would like this better if it was fresher. The hops have faded which allows the malt to come off to sweet and syrupy. Full body. Thick, creamy mouthfeel. Definitely intense and interesting. Hope to try an ultra fresh one in the future but not sure if thats possible with this being brewed in Denmark and put in green colored bottles.

Bottled, BB 29/05/18, large sample. Dark color, big rocky lightbrown head. Aroma of piney hops together with roasted malts, some mocha, hint of strawberry, slight coffee. Quite bitter in taste, mocha like sweetness. These black IPAs lately are seriously evolving and taking it to a whole other level. I was a bit sarcastic at first, but now I love them! Wonderful example of a black IPA with additions!
From Belair Fine Wines. Very nice! great aroma, Some bitter, sour and sweetness blended together. Really good alcohol feel. Light and very drinkable.

Bottle at home. Medium high but long lasting creamy and good looking light brown head. Yep black it is. Creamy sweet and yet powerful coffee aroma with just a wee bit bitter notes. Flavor is cafe mocha up front with vanilla, some salt on the lips, mouth-drying hops and a touch of wood through the middle, and back to espresso aftertaste on the long end. Smooth creamy milkshake mouthfeel, this one has absolutely zero hint of its formidable alcohol content. Its a very interesting beer, lovely on the tongue, layering quite a decent black IPA snap behind the aroma of a charred imperial stout, and fascinating to unpack. Certainly not as thirst-quenching as my ideal black IPA would be. More critically, it never quite gels into a style that should have existed but didnt until now - rather, it comes off as a nice and not unsuccessful "experimental" beer.

En importation à la succursale (cuvée nov. 2013): Superbe liquide marron et mousseux, dentelle complexe et vivante. Le spectre de larôme est vaste, café, coco, mélasse, chocolat, agrumes, verdure. En bouche cest onctueux et habité par des sucres bien balancés par les houblons et une charge saline en fin de bouche. Buvabilité certaine.

Il sen passe des choses dans cette bière ouf! Tout dabord, cest visuellement assez standard pour le style, une robe noire opaque moussant abondamment remplit le verre. Au nez, une symbiose quasi parfaite entre le chocolat, le café et les houblons dégageant des notes dagrumes nous fait rêver. Cest tout dabord lamertume du café et du houblon qui attaque la langue, mais à la fin de la gorgée, laspect salin se fait sentir. Dailleurs, vous remarquerez la présence du sel sur vos lèvres au fur et à mesure que la dégustation progresse. Plus la bière tempère, plus elle devient aqueuse et la salinité se fait plus présente, ce qui confirme que cest préférable de boire cette bière assez froide, mais pas trop.

Ja riktigt jävla svart. Doftar fin humle blandat med riktigt bra kaffe!?. Jihoo. Smakar likadant som tidigare beskrivet i meningen innan denna. Bra vinter öl eller efter middagen vid öppna elden. Eller om du vill bli dragen 9,9%. Skål
This Black Imperial IPA brewed with black malts and french press coffee is all I need in a beer. Incredible full and rich. Balance is perfect.

bought a bottle after borefts. one of the beers i didnt taste on the festival. poured pitch black with a big creamy tan head. a lot of coffee and malts, with a big hoppy flavour with citrus and bitterness of grapeftuit en orange peel and some pines to. verry nice an dthick mouthfeel.
12.7-oz bottle from wlvliquors. wow. coffee, chocolate, hops in background. big brown head when poured the right way. ill say it again, wow.

Bottle. Black colour with a light beige head, very creamy, large with good lasting and veri nice lacework. Aroma is roasty with citrus and resins hops with notes of coffee as well. Flavor is very fresh, slightly notes of black chocolate and coffee, roasty with a good maltiness, good bitterness. The final has a decent bitterness with good duration, very fresh.

33cl bottle. Pitch black with medium, tanned head. 
NOSE : strong aromas of black tea, fresh coffee, pine and zest, cheese, nuts, black chocolate, wet stone.
SIP : medium body with light carbonation. Creamy and smooth. The beer is sweet with notes of black chocolate, coffee with milk. It develops some funky booze with dark fruits and blue cheese like flavors. It gets a bit dry and bitter revealing flavors of coffee, black chocolate and citrus seeds. 
Aftertaste is dry and bitter with mineral and earthy notes.
OVERALL : what a complex brew. Wide spectrum of flavors that are well balanced and delicious. There is a mysterious funky something to it. Its the first time I try a beer with body salts in it so I guess that might be it.

Bottle. Completely black color, brown ice cream cone head with good retention and solid lacing. Nice aroma of bright pine and Christmas tree boughs with edges of coffee and cocoa. Taste is bitter pine resin, unsweetened espresso, licorice, bitter chocolate. Very tasty.

A reddish black beer, with a light brown firm head. When cold the fruityness of the hops are stronger than the coffee, later the coffee becomes stronger. It is a medium bodied beer, with a very nice carbonation. In the taste there are loads of coffee, a good hop bitterness, and a light sweet touch, probably the alcohol. The aftertaste is strong coffee bitter, and dries the mouth. A very nice bipa, one of the better ones.

On tap at Red Bear pub (Marghera). Bella schiuma scura, alta e che dissipa con effetto sapone sul bicchiere, colore scuro, aroma meraviglioso di malto tostati, note di caffè, frutti tropicali e pompelmo, al palato corpo medio nonostante limportante nota alcolica e bassa carbonazione, dolce ed amara insieme con note che riprendono laroma con laggiunta di cioccolata amara. Un grandissima black Ipa !!

28th August 2013Opaque dark brown beer with a big tan head. Palate is smooth and slightly soft. Mild fine carbonation. Sweetish dark malt with mellow coffee and a little dark chocolate. Sweetish pine with light tropical fruits. Sweet dark malt cream comes through and contrasts with the coffee becoming more bitter. Very smooth and tasty and super drinkable.

375mL bottle, pours black with a medium tan head. Nose of rich roasted malt, black coffee, and some bittering hops poking through. Flavour is amazingly rich and complex, with equal parts rich roasted malt, quality black coffee, and piney hops. Extremely rich and full-bodied, with a very dry, creamy palate. Finishes roasty and lightly bitter. One of the best black IPAs Ive had. Superb.
On tap @ brewdog, Leeds. One of best beers I have had. If you like black ipas check it out, absolute stunner!

Bottle. Pours opaque black with a ginormous dark brown head that eventually dissipates leaving lacing all over the place. Aroma is roasty, coffee, citrus and pine, toffee and dark sugars. Flavor is medium sweet and lightly bitter, roasty but lacking a lot of hop character other than bitterness. Medium body, finish is a bit harsh. ABV was quite well masked.

330 ml bottle courtesy of Jacob. Thanks. Pours an opaque black color with a big foamy khaki head that has great retention. The aroma is mild coffee, sea foam and roasted grains. The flavor is very nice coffee accompanied by nutty hops and some more of that sea foam. The palate is full and viscous with soft carbonation. Finishes long and dry with lingering bitter coffee. Overall: Another winner.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 28.09.2013, tap @ Borefts:
Nice brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet hoppy, dark malts, rubber, hops, licorice, coffee, dark sugar, leafs, pine needles. Taste is slightly sweet and dry, dark malts, hops, pine needles, leafs, rubber, oak, cardboard, licorice, coffee. Longlasting bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Bottle. 
Dark brown with a beige brown head leaving lacing. 
Hoppy aroma with tropical fruits, roasted coffee beans. 
Taste : peach, grapefruit, pine, coffee, licorice, burnt rubber, cocoa powder, medium bitter. 
Medium bodied. 
This is nice, and could not guess this was almost 10%.

Tons of roasted malt, prominent coffee, primarily pine for the hop profile accompanied by some citrus. Firm, but not overbearing bitterness provides an interesting counterpoint to the richness of the coffee. Really nice stuff!
Bottle at The Trappist. Pours black with a nice tan head and a chocolate aroma. There is a sturdy dark molasses flavor with heavy coffee and a bitter finish. Very well-crafted.

FUCK! This is truly fucked. Motherfucker. Fucking delightful. Quite simply fucking incredible. Its not something I often talk about but in an odd way, this reminded me of a near boiling coffee enema I once had in rural Djibouti. Weird times. Fuck me. What a beer.
From bottle at the trappist. Pours black with brown head. Aroma was roasted malt. Taste was more on the stout side. Ashy roasted malts with some hop bitterness.

Back on the ratebeer horse (thanks to this beer). Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours pitch black with a creamy, light khaki head. Immediate aroma of dark chocolate powder, quality espresso, sea salt, piney hops and a touch of soy. My god. Flavours are immaculate - perfect balance between the pine and resin hop IPA presence blended with rich but not overpowering dark mocha roastiness. Velvety smooth thick body and lingering dry salty bitterness you dont get in your average dark beer. Amazing collaboration of flavours, I tip my hat off to To Ol once more for another brilliant brew.

Fad: Sort øl med en god duft af humle, masser af saft og kraft men desværre var smagsløgene lidt ristede her sidst på aftenen. Fin øl men er stadig ikke helt tilvænnet til sort ipa, der er noget der clasher inde i mit hoved.

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours a dark black with a tanned frothy head. Nose is fantastic. Fresh Citrus hops, roasted coffee, powdered chocolate and roasted malts. The citrus hops are so juicy in the flavour! Real sense of freshness with this one. Coffee undertones with a powdery cocoa bitterness clings to the palate and lasts. 10% abv hidden incredibly well, usual standard from to øl of late. Fucking awesome beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2015 Black with a big fluffy off brown head. There is a huge aroma of roasted coffee, big malts, some slight bark. On the tongue it is quite creamy, not very full bodied considering the abv, coffee dominates leading to a bitter finish.

33cl bottle. It pours a deep brown color with a large brown head. Aroma is deep roasted malts, coffee beans and some wood. Citrus and pineapple, good hoppy profile. Taste is mostly bitter with roasted malts, coffee beans, wood, pine needles. Quite dry bitter finish. Overall, very good and enjoyable.

Tap at Borefts 13.
Black colour on the body,thin beige head with average retention.Light lacing on the glasS.
Aroma of coffee, fresh cut grass, tropical fruits.
Great taste, very surprised by this one. Lots of coffee but also quite fruity as well, roasted malts, citurs.
Medium body, good amount of carbonation, dry palate.
Overall a great black IPA, amazing.

Bottle from bieresgourmet.be webshop. Pours a pitch black body with a large creamy mocha-hued head, rendering the beer pretty freakin gorgeous. Nose is cocoa, coffee, bath salts, licorice, herbs; licorice and grass far in the back with hints of caramel. Taste is sweet malts, big coffee tones, dark chocolate, resinous hops, wet leaves, grass and hints of licorice, salt and soapy herbs. Lingering salt and resin in the aftertaste. Full, creamy body, medium carbonation. Wow, this is really original AND well brewed - a lot of flavors here but they all interact very nicely; even the bath salt thing really works out in some weird way. Very tasty and a nice surprise from To Øl (which tend to do that quite often, actually).

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown excellent mostly lasting head. Black colour. moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. heavy bitter flavor. Strong coffee notes. long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. too much coffe notes to be world class but still nice.
Piekna brązowa piana, zapach kawy wymieszanej z cytrusami, smak kawy, ale bez kwaskowości z nutami cytrusów.

Keg at IMBC 2013. It pours dark brown with a medium light tan head. The nose is roasty, berry, tart dark fruit, plum, jammy, toast, coffee and brown sugar. The taste is rich roast, tart berry, salted liquorice, caramel, decent bitterness, cocoa and toast with a bitter, roasty finish. Med+ body and fine, prickly carbonation. Delicious and well balanced.

Bottle @ home ...It pours black with a large creamy beige head....The aroma is fresh hops, citrus, roasted malt and coffee beans fruity....The flavor is very nice!...citrus, fresh hops, coffee, roasted malt and sweet licorice.... very nice brew from TO ØL!

Draft at Borefts 2013. Pours dark brown with a small tanned head. Aroma of coffee and roasted malts. Taste has coffee, licorice, roasted malts, chocolate, a little bit of fruitiness and a long bitter and coffee finish. Medium to full body and medium carbo. More of a stout than a black IPA I guess.
Tap at Borefts. Black colour with white head. Hoppy and coffee aroma. Hoppy, coffee and bitter taste, slightly salty, roasted. Medium to full body.

Aroma: Lemony pineapple with an edge of dark caramel, coffee and herbs.
Appearance: Black, opaque, small tan head.
Taste: Slightly sour leading through bitter to hot coffee .
Palate: Medium bodied, smooth, well-carbonated and a bitter biting finish.
Overall: Almost a stout but with enough hop character to keep you wondering. Good but not awesome.

Schwarz, schöne schaumkrone, im aroma hopfen und fruchtig, gehaltvoll, kaffe, fruchtig, süsslich, schokolade, mässige bittere

Bottle. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is coffee, alcohol, roasted malt, hop, pine. Flavour is coffee, alcohol, roasted malt, hop, licorice, pine. Full body. Very nice beer.

Bouteille 33cl de HopDuvel, BB 29/05/2018.
De couleur ambrée, col épais café au lait.
Arôme est agréable avec ici une bière qui tient sa promesse; café. Malt léger grillé, avec un houblonné citronné subtile, présent mais un peu discret.
Palais est sympa et offre une petite alternance avec cet ajout de café. Ce dernier accompagne bien le côté malté grillé et caramel. Le tout avec des notes de citronné voire de pamplemousse. Le café apporte un petit plus pour une bière qui reste sans cela une Black Ipa basique et qui ici aussi aurait pu avoir juste une peu moins dalcool.

330ml bottle from Bierkompass, thanks lusikka!

Pours pitch black with a small light brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, espresso, some dark chocolate and hints of bitter hoppiness and slight vegetable notes. Taste is roasty, malty and smooth with loads of coffee, dark chocolate, espresso and hints of dark ripe fruits, salty licorice and dry bitter hoppiness. Finish is smooth, roasty and hoppy with long lasting lingering fruity bitterness, salty licorice, coffee and dark chocolate notes. Quite tasty and heavy black IPA. A bit unbalanced, though.

Bottled. Pours deep brown, nearly black with a large light brown head, that leaves an excellent lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, citrus, licorice notes and coffee. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and solid bitter. Medium to full bodied, oily to creamy text. and soft carb. A great full bodied black IPA.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2016 Mooie donkerbruine, bijna zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Fruitige hopgeur, koffie, iets ziltig. Smaakt fris, fruitig, hop, koffie en een zoete natoon van koffie. Lekkere bittere nasmaak.

Very thick & dense dark beige head over very deep dark brown beer; lacerings. Aromatic New World hops, but also an astringent smell, as ammonium. Roasted/burnt malts. Green herbs - no coffee to smell. Black, roasted malts, roasted grains... but as to coffee? Bitterish-sweetish, faintly mineral. Not very complex. Warming up, straw & cilandro. Feels quite carbonated, quite slick to viscous, well-bodied. Yet an empty feel in the finish, probably due to total fermentation of the sugar? Yeah... it isnt anywhere bad. But black IPAs are usually quite interesting, even complex brews, and this is neither. Im still searching for the coffee.

Borefts 2013. Poured watery black with a frothy head. Aroma of roast coffee, roast malt and citrus hops. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, orange notes, some salty chocolate.
@Borefts. Nice black IPA with some notes of coffee. I expected more from it due to the promising name.

Sample at SBWF 2013. 

Black with a tan head. Aroma and taste of coffee, hops, roasted malt and some salt. Fresh and stimulating.
Draught at Borefts, 2013. Nose of salty coffee, fruity oranges. Espresso flavor with nice citrus hops. A clean, well-hopped stout, and very nice.
Bottle 33 cl, BBE 05/2018. Black in color with a small tan head. Raw coffee beans in aroma. Taste has some similar notes of coffee beans and a bit of sweeter cocoa notes that lingers beneath.
Lovely deep dark beer. Big in the mouth with roasted malts, coffee, liquorice and beautifully balanced with the hop bitterness and slight saltiness.
Very good ipa and stout mix With Coffee added. Manages to be stout smooth and ipa hoppy while having a nice Coffee mix taste
Bottle from brewdog online store. Black color, big light brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee, licorice, hops. Nice taste of roasted malts, hops, coffee, licorice.
Bottle. Black. Dried coffee, sea salt on nose. Full body, quite tasty. Really like the salty flavours.-- bb/wp8

33cl bottle @ Brewdog Stockholm. Black with a brown head. Citrusy hops, roasty aroma, woody notes, oatmeal. Flavor has coffee all over, strong coffee, sweetness, muscovado, roastedness, hops. Long finish, bitter, cocoa, coffee lingering. Mouthdrying.-- via beerbasher/winphone 7

light beige head disappears quickly without lacing. coffee colour. aroma slight hoppy, coffee, roasted malts. taste roasted malts, hop fruitiness, slight (lactic) sweetness aftertaste quite bitter. quite dry mouthfeel, medium body and carbonation. nice and well balanced, abv well hidden. tap @ borefts 13
On tap @ Borefts. Pours black with a thin off-white head. Aroma of coffee and grassy hops. Sweet black coffee taste, with grassy finish
clear coffee aromas some roasted aromas, appear total black with a fine white head.light bitter medium sweetness. great creamy texture, with a average carbonation.

Its more like an imperial porter then a black ipa, but again it may be a bit old. It dont much coffee but I taste a sweetness that resemble a sweet imperial stout. Not bad but as advertised...next week double damon!

33 cl bottle. BBE 29.05.2018.
Pours jet black color with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma of hops, roasted malts, citric fruits, faint licorice notes and some salty notes. Coffee is barely noticeable at first but starts to burst out with some spins and as the beer warms up a bit. All in all a very appealing aroma.
Flavor is also roasty, hoppy and fruity, a bit sweet with caramel even. Some salty licorice, malts and some mild coffee notes appear also. Soft carbonation, very heavy body, roasted malty palate with bitter fruity and hoppy finish. Alcohol is very well hidden. Complex and extremely tasty. Excellent.

330ml bottle. Quasi black colour with huge, creamy, fully lasting, superbly lacing, beige head. Intense citrusy hop aroma, grapefruit, orange zest, some pine, roasty, salty, dark malty background with hints of coffee. Taste is roasty dark malty, intense coffee notes, subtle sweetness, intertwixed with bitter, herbal, piney hop notes, some fruity hints of orange, orange zest, grapefruit. Wow! Superb, harmonic balance, intense but not overdone - excellent stuff!
To Øl Black Malts & Body Salts Black Coffee IIPA 9,9%. Duft:kaffe, ristet malt, appelsin. Smag: humle, appelsin, citrus, kaffe, ristet brød/malt,

Bottle @ Hj Hansen, Odense. Pours black with a creamy beige head and lacings. Nose is coffee, fresh hops and roast. Extremely fresh coffee and hops. Bitter roasted and hoppy flavor and finish.  A bit salty. Smooth and soft. Above nice.

Several bottles and draft specimens have been drunk, and I say YES! This is good good stuff! The aroma bursts of pungent hops that intertwine with fruity coffee. Focused on citrus and stone fruits, which is a really good choice along with the coffee and its berry-like fruitiness. Small whiffs of black malts, chocolate and prunes, although focused on hops and coffee all the way. At this point, 3,5 after bottling, the most aggressive hop focus in the taste is gone, and theres now more space for the coffee and the sweet malts. Grapefruit, coffee and dark caramel on the front of the palate and an insisting bitterness in the back of the palate. A bit of roasty bitterness in the finish to go with the hops. This is a bad ass beer. One of the best of the style Ive ever had.

Sampled at the London Craft Beer Festival 2013. Pours deep brown with a foamy tan head. Great stuff. Ballsy coffee character, some alcohol bite. Good dark chocolate notes, a bit of dark fruit. Full bodied with fine, creamy carbonation. Moderately warming to finish, some earthy bitterness, rich coffee, more dark chocolate. Superb.

Totally black color with huge beige and lasting to the end head. Very intensive aroma of coffee, roasted malts and some hops. Taste is perfectly balanced of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and citrus hops. After that feels minimal alcohol note. Beginning is very bitter, but finish is roasty. Its full of everything what you can find in good stout and in good IIPA. Aboslutely fantastic!
33cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2013, with coffee, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex brew, roasted/bitter and slightly spicy/fruity, balanced, hazy, rocky head, very good brew, yet expensive!
@ Ölkväll i Helsingborg. Massor av kaffe/kaffebönor både i doften o smaken. Härligt! Riktigt bra beska och en lång eftersmak. (Precis som jag vill ha det!)

330ml bottle at home. How many styles do you want to combine in one beer? Maybe make this a black sour smoked coffee IPA saison next time and be done with it! Pours black with a thin white short-lived head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, orange, burnt toast. Taste has saline qualities, and a more roasted malted bitterness. It actually gets a bit sour and bretty about halfway down. Then a bit metallic, from the coffee I guess. OK.
Bottle at home... Deep dark black... Thin tan head... Soft roast... Big coffee roast nose... Chewy malts... Soft malt... Dark chocolate... Heavy hop

Aroma: roasted coffee, hoppy.
Appearance: black color, very nice beige lasting head.
Taste: medium bitterness (hops and alcohol), roasted coffee, light ash, perceptible warming alcohol - very complex taste.
Palate: medium carbonation, full body, roasted finish.
Overall: Outstanding Coffee IIPA. Very nice combination of Black IIPAs features with roasted coffee. Complex and aggresive taste, drinkable, and there is no doubts that this is real coffee Black IIPA.
Bottle. Pours almost black with a nice brown head. Aroma is burnt coffee, chocolate and grass. Taste is toffee, caramel, chocolate, coffee. Quite bitter. A bit weird finish, soft carbonation.

bottle from kihosk. pretty damn black; aroma of coffee, red grape, last nights campfire; loads of flavour - prunes, tobacco, chocolate fondue, vanilla custard, plenty of burnt bitterness. pretty potent stuff

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with medium to big tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, pine, citrus, grapefruit, tangerine and bread. Taste is light sweet and medium to high bitter with notes of citrus, coffee, chocolate, pine and tangerine. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice stuff.

very dark brown, huge brown head.
Aroma is hops and grinded coffee , also some roasted malts in there. ever slightly herbal, but very refreshing and very nice.Flavor is coffee, hops, roasted malts, lots of coffee, it all blends very well together.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a little sediment and a tan head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, and grapefruit. Flavour is much like the aroma  with a bitter finish.

09-AUG-2013, bottle @home, from Kihoskh. 
Black with huge tan head. Laces in circular rings down the glass. 
Roasted burnt coffee aroma with mineral-like, tea' ish hops. Grape fruit, tobaco. 
Taste the same. Above average body, medium carbonation. Long bitter finish with roast and hops. Well balanced. Very creamy. Well hidden alcohol. Fantastic black ipa.

330 ml bottle.
Pours a pitch black colour with a large beige head. Aroma of pungent fresh roasted coffee, very strong floral hops and grapefruit. Flavour is rather strong and roasty with pungent coffee, floral hops, salty licorice, some caramel, peach and pineapple. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and a long, lingering bitter, dry finish. A heavy black IPA with very prominent bitterness. My kind of a beer.

Bottle. Pitch black with a big, solid, beige head. Aroma is extremely well balanced!!! Its not the hops or the malts that are the first impression - its both!! I wanna say something like roasted hops. The malts give a very, very roasty, dark, burned bread character along side with the hops which are dominated by citrus aromas. Overall, a roasted, almost burned hop aroma - nice! 
First impression on the palate is a very dark malted, bitter, coffee-like flavor. It then moves into a nice, cleaner, simpler malt profile and finishes with an aftertaste thats definitely dominated by a bitter citrus hop flavor. Mouthfeel is bigger side of medium thanks to the oats and dry. Not an insanely coffee forward black IPA in the beginning, but as it gets warmer, the coffee is more present for sure. A super nice, well balanced Coffee Black IPA. Absolutely no hints of the 9.9 % ABV - wow, I didnt even realize this before now :D
Bottle. Black beer with a beige head. Coffee, malty, sweetish, aroma. Lovely coffee flavour dark fruits and licorice hints. Nice balanced lovely beer.

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Black beer with a nice lasting beige head. Fresh coffee aroma, dried fruits, hops, vanilla notes, roasted, soot, salty notes, some cocoa. Great mix of coffee and hops, bitter, roasted, soot, salty, licorice, dark chocolate, fruity, citrus, caramel, tar notes. Hoppy coffee finish. Great beer and alcohol is very well hidden.

Bottle at John Bull. Pours pitch black with a big, dense light brown head. Roasted hoppy aroma. Medium full body, roasted. Hoppy and coffee flavour. Medium bitter.

On tap. Pours black with a creamy beige head. Aroma is fruity and citrussy hops with notes of coffee, roasted malt and licorice. Flavour is pine, bitter coffee, chocolate, licorice and sweet roasted malts. Wow!

bottled. dark with beige head. lots of coffee and fruit (peach?). great first impression by the aroma of marihuanna, but not sticky and powerfull enough in my opinion and expectation, but definitely underrated so far! (3.48)

All this is very well rounded with the high abv, some burned sugar and fruity notes from both the coffee and the slightly exotic fruits from the hops. I actually really like this compared to many other black IPAs, since they tend to lose the fruityness and body that the coffee can actually offer. Still something slight watery though.

Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee beans, salty liqourice, honey, roasted pine nuts, heather. Taste is chocolate, coffee, salty liqourice, with hints of honey, heather and some faint orange zest tones. Excellent!!
